programme.title: Born and Bred
programme.desc: Len and Linda are delighted when their first foster child arrives, but their joy is cut short by the discovery that the youngster isn't quite what they were expecting. Meanwhile, Tom and Arthur bicker over the medical treatment of Rita Lennox, the woman sent to turn the local pub into a tourist trap

programme.title: Born and Bred
programme.desc: The tension between Tom and Arthur reaches breaking point, and it seems a journey to New Zealand is on the cards for one of the doctors. Elsewhere, the arrival of Reverend Brewer's brother causes a stir when he makes an announcement concerning their uncle's death, and Eddie has further tests on a suspicious lump, throwing his wedding to Jean in doubt

programme.title: Born and Bred
programme.desc: Richard Wilson joins the cast as a new doctor who arrives in Ormston, much to the dismay of Tom who learns the newcomer's timely appearance has been engineered by his father. Their working relationship gets off to a bad start too, when they bicker over how to treat a case of polio. Elsewhere, Wilf's plans for a double wedding are nipped in the bud by Jean, and the Cosgroves struggle to cope with their foster-daughter's hi-jinks, while Deborah and Phyllis unearth the truth behind the village-wide eviction notices

programme.title: Howards' Way
programme.desc: Jack and Avril clash over Tom's ideas

programme.title: Howards' Way
programme.desc: Jack is thunderstruck when Kate tells him that Tom is her son-in-law. Polly lies to Leo about Abby's whereabouts

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Part two of two. Detective-cum-chef Henry Crabbe continues his investigations into the murder of a stable-hand, but faces pressure from Fisher as a second body is discovered. Meanwhile, the friendship between Margaret and Bob Bishop arouses suspicion. Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed star

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe helps the owners of a local Chinese takeaway whose pride and takings are steadily being eroded by racist attacks, while the Great British Grub competition looks set to be a roaring success. Comedy drama, starring Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe agrees to cook for a reluctant witness in a police safe house, and comes under threat from both a ruthless villain and an unscrupulous copper. Meanwhile, Henderson is alarmed by an unwelcome reminder of a past indiscretion. Comedy drama, starring Richard Griffiths

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: The final episode of the detective drama sees Gently testifying against corrupt Met officers as he prepares to retire from the force. However, he is persuaded to take on one final investigation - re-opening the case of a woman who was murdered four years previously. Gently's search for the truth leads him to investigate a reforming politician who is tipped to become the next prime minister and uncover a web of political intrigue that places Bacchus and Rachel in danger. Starring Martin Shaw, Lee Ingleby and Lisa McGrillis

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: The chairman of the Classic Car Restoration Society is found dead alongside his beloved El Dorado with a lungful of gasoline. The investigators try to determine whether his fate was due to a petrol siphoning accident or something more deliberate. They also wonder whether it was linked to an unidentified dead body found in his garage the day before. Neill Rea and Fern Sutherland star

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Lady Felicia is horrified to find an injured man stuck in a tree on her estate, apparently thrown there from a passing train on an overhead viaduct. When Sid is implicated as the guilty party, Father Brown is left to clear his name - but only if he is truly innocent. Mystery drama, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: Rebellion
programme.desc: A ruthless campaign of executions is carried out, but the deaths have the unintended result of building public support for the defeated rebels. As prisoners are shipped to England, May is persecuted by the authorities, while Frances is driven to take drastic action

programme.title: The Split
programme.desc: Hannah finds herself caught in the middle when Nathan and Christie clash on a highly charged divorce case involving fertility law and the ownership of frozen embryos. Meanwhile, Ruth continues to evade questions regarding Oscar's return and the concern over Defoe's finances. Drama, starring Nicola Walker

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: A film star arrives from America and throws a summer garden party for the entire village of St Mary Mead - where one of her fans drinks a poisoned cocktail and promptly drops dead. Fortunately, the guest list includes Miss Marple, who immediately sets about tracking down the killer. Feature-length drama, starring Joan Hickson, Claire Bloom and Barry Newman

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: When a series of monstrous and seemingly indiscriminate killings become ever more audacious and public, DCI John Luther and new recruit DS Catherine Halliday are confounded by a complex tangle of leads and misdirection that seems designed to protect an untouchable corruption. But, even as the case brings him closer than ever to the true face of evil, a reluctant Luther is forced to confront the unburied demons of his own recent past. Idris Elba stars, with Wunmi Mosaku and Patrick Malahide

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A police warehouse used to store millions of pounds' worth of luxury sports cars is targeted by arch-villains the Fosters, who have enlisted undercover cop Ken Drummond to be their reluctant inside man. However, when the unfortunate DC's failure to report in is noted at Sun Hill, Debbie McAllister and Juliet Becker are dispatched to find out what's going on

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the bungled robbery, Ken is rushed to hospital, but when word gets out that the crooks are planning to target his son Alex in revenge, the wounded DC faces a race against time to save the youngster. Meanwhile, his colleagues try to fathom who would have the bottle to cheat the Fosters out of their booty _ and how so many luxury cars could simply disappear

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Phil Hunter and Juliet Becker think they've stumbled across the car gang's hideaway, but when the bikers make a sudden reappearance, the duo find themselves in a tricky situation. Ken Drummond ignores his colleagues' advice and sets out to rescue his son from the clutches of the Fosters. Reg Hollis's previously unsuspected dark side comes to light when an investigation into an attack on a brothel reveals he's on familiar terms with the madam

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gina Gold and Gary Best fear the worst after hearing gunshots from the warehouse where Ken Drummond and his son are being held hostage. Dale Smith goes undercover in a high-security prison in an attempt to find out where the stolen sports cars have been hidden, and the hunt is on for whoever's responsible for the sudden influx of teenage prostitutes in the area

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gary Best goes undercover to investigate the prostitution racket targeting girls from the North, but as he ingratiates himself with one of the new arrivals, his colleagues lose sight of him. Jim Carver returns from his honeymoon, leading to discord with June Ackland, who still feels bitter toward her ex's new wife Marie, and Reg Hollis puts his foot in it with Sheelagh Murphy

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Lucille treats an elderly hoarder (Annette Crosbie) suffering from a malodorous leg ulcer, and fears that living surrounded by towering piles of rubbish, books and tins of food will have a serious effect on her recovery. Sister Hilda has a challenging case on her hands when a family newly arrived from Ghana are found to be suffering from an unidentified illness, and Violet runs for a place on the local council, but Fred is not convinced she can make a difference to the community, placing more faith in the Civil Defence Corps

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Bucket pays a visit to his old enemy Fagin, convinced the criminal had a part to play in the murder of Jacob Marley. The encounter sets him on the trail of Fagin's old partner in crime Bill Sikes, whose wooden cosh could provide the vital clue that will solve the case. Meanwhile, Frances comes up with an idea to ruin her sister's plans

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: The Havishams throw a New Year's party. Amelia is delighted to be reunited with her brother Arthur, but is troubled when an unexpected guest joins the celebrations. Meanwhile, Frances Barbary rekindles an old friendship and allows herself to hope that it may develop into something more

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's A Dinner of Herbs
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part drama based on the novel by Catherine Cookson, starring Billie Whitelaw as a herbalist who takes an 11-year-old orphan under her wing. With Tim Healy, Jonathan Kerrigan and Michael Jayston

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Felix gets more than he bargained for when a bawdy film production comes to Great Slaughter

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Highly regarded police officer DI Adrian Fell is invited to appear on Carla's Eyes and Ears true crime show, but the inquisitive amateur detective wonders what she has got herself into when evidence emerges that appears to implicate him in a murder. As Jonathan tries to separate truth from lies, he begins to suspect a mysterious chequered box belonging to the officer could hold the key to the conundrum. Offbeat detective drama, starring Alan Davies, Julia Sawalha and Colin McFarlane

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: The disappearance of a priceless Japanese porcelain figurine from a municipal museum triggers a series of tragic events, raising the ominous possibility that it could be cursed. As Jonathan and Carla search for the missing statuette, they are led on a quest deep into a sinister forest where an ancient beech tree could hold the key to the mystery. Offbeat detective drama, starring Alan Davies

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: The crime thriller returns with the first of a two-part story, starring Rupert Penry-Jones. Chandler, Miles and the team investigate the murder of a man crushed to death by stones. As the killer's macabre methods become clearer, a second body is discovered and the detectives suspect the executions are being carried out by a witch hunter. However, their progress is impeded as links to 20th-century espionage attract attention from the security services. With Phil Davis and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Part two of two. A connection to a 16th-century murder seems to confirm someone is killing witches in Whitechapel. Chandler is on the case, but is there a malign influence at work within the team? The police station itself appears to pulsate with unexplained phenomena and even the usually hard-bitten Miles starts to ask questions. Crime thriller, starring Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Steve Pemberton

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: Part one of two. On a leave of absence from the police force, DCI John Luther is laying low in a rundown cottage. However, a visit from colleagues at the Met brings a piece of news that draws him back to London in search of the truth. Meanwhile, a cannibal serial killer has struck the city, and Luther is soon racing against the clock to stop them before they strike again. Drama, starring Idris Elba and Warren Brown

programme.title: Broken
programme.desc: As events of the night send shockwaves through the community, Father Michael must process his own guilt. Seeing Helen's humility and dignity in the face of overwhelming pain, he turns to Father Peter for advice. Elsewhere, PC Andrew Powell is pressured by PC Dawn Morris and their fellow officers to back up their account of the night before - even though it goes against everything he stands for, and Roz remains determined to go through with her plan, despite Father Michael trying to dissuade her

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: The detective must confront a demon from his past, as both the police and Cornelius converge on his home. With Halliday convinced that the body in the morgue isn't their killer, can Luther put his own troubles to one side and find the true murderer before he strikes again? Thriller, starring Idris Elba, Ruth Wilson and Dermot Crowley

programme.desc: Alfie's joy is short-lived when he hears some news. Meanwhile, Vicki says her farewells

programme.desc: Kat and Alfie's date goes badly. Patrick is devastated by Anthony's life-changing decision

programme.desc: Hamish takes his holiday on the island of Laggan-Laggan, only to find himself caught up in a mystery from 20 years previously. programme.desc: The antiques dealer is asked to track down an itinerant painter who holds the key to a shameful secret. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane

programme.desc: A hypochondriac becomes the bane of Joanna's life, wasting time and resources with a string of fictitious illnesses, while Andrew attempts to help a girl's parents come to terms with her deafness. Medical drama, starring Gary Mavers and Haydn Gwynne

programme.desc: Following the death of a resident, Tom puts himself forward as a counsellor to aid and comfort the terminally ill. Meanwhile, Jane becomes confused when she overhears Tom and Diana's discussion over the existence of God. Comedy, starring Stephanie Cole and Graham Crowden

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber takes up boxing and enters the prison championships. He is hot favourite to win until Fletcher is given the task of fixing the contest and nobbling his cell-mate. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Peter Vaughan

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Eric Sykes guest stars as absent-minded Doggy, who is disappointed when his stag night fails to live up to his expectations. However, Clegg, Truly, Alvin and Entwistle come up with a solution and soon rectify the situation. With Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Brian Murphy

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: An innocuous section of woodland soon becomes a legendary site renowned for its ghostly activity, due to the inventive rumours put about by Alvin, Truly and Clegg. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Brian Murphy

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: Mod stands in the local election and soon clashes with councillor Marjorie Balsam, who proves to have more than her fair share of sleaze to hide. Meanwhile, Dangerous is called out to settle a routine dispute over a leylandii hedge that escalates when the taunts turn racist and human remains start turning up in one householder's vegetable patch. An apparent suicide on the railway tracks and reports of schoolgirls surreptitiously visiting the local pharmacist ensure that the oddball detective has a full and satisfying Bank Holiday shift. Lynda Bellingham guest stars

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad is ordered by its new boss to look into the unsolved murder of a barrister found bound and gagged in his car 25 years ago. The case was a rare failure for a former chief inspector, although his notes point to a very clear suspect. As they uncover the late advocate's unusual hobbies, they gradually learn exactly what happened. Anita Dobson, Jenny Agutter and Keith Barron guest star

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The unsolved-crime squad reopens the case of an Asian woman who was attacked eight years ago, and has been in a coma ever since. Nina Wadia, Keith Allen and Navin Chowdhry guest star

programme.desc: Following the death of her husband, Queen Mary returns to Scotland after years reigning in France. programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A man narrowly escapes death in a remote ravine after his dog alerts local walkers of his plight, and a car enthusiast faces dire consequences when he buys back a favourite motor

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate helps put a lion pride into another lion's territory to analyse the current social structure. The keepers carry out essential health checks on the park's new red pandas

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell visit a three-bedroom terrace in Rugby, a former working men's club in Bolsover and a three bedroom semi in Nottingham which are all up for sale at online auctions. The team follows progress on building work to see if any of the developers can turn a profit on their investments

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents today's show from Hele in Devon, and visits a Victorian catacomb. The reds and the blues are led by John Cameron and Stephanie Connell

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the opening day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Novak Djokovic will be first up on Centre Court, having won his fourth consecutive title here and his seventh overall after overcoming Nick Kyrgios in the 2022 final. Having already won the Australian and French Opens this year, Djokovic is aiming to become the first man since Rod Laver in 1969 to win all four Grand Slam events in the same year. One of his main challengers could well be Carlos Alcaraz, who is the last man other than Djokovic to win a Grand Slam, having won the US Open in 2022, which contributed to a spell at the top of the world rankings

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the opening day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. In the ladies' competition, there were straight-set victories for eventual runner-up Ons Jabeur and second seed Anett Kontaveit over MIrjam Bjorklund and Bernarda Pera on day one last year. In the men's event, Wimbledon continued to be the one Grand Slam that has eluded Stan Wawrinka, when he lost 7-5, 4-6, 6-3, 6-2 to a man 17 years his junior in Jannik Sinner

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: After 15 years of fostering, Stephen and Lynn Smedley were looking forward to their well-earned retirement in Carbis Bay, Cornwall. However, the dream dramatically changed when their daughter died, leaving them caring for their three grandsons. The boys, still grieving for their mum's untimely death, are forced to share a single bedroom with a triple bunkbed. There is only one bathroom and Lynn is forced to do the ironing in the shed due to lack of space. Enter Nick Knowles and the team. Their plan is to reconfigure and enlarge their home to accommodate three growing boys - with the help of hundreds of volunteers

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: We Hunt Together
programme.desc: Lola and Jackson find one thing they can agree on after interviewing Freddy. Freddy and Baba seize upon an opportunity to solve two problems with another killing

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team celebrate the 75th anniversary of the National Health Service by restoring items chronicling the evolution of the publicly funded healthcare system. First into the barn are nurses Catherine and Katie who bring metal-man Dominic Chinea a Thomas the Tank Engine food trolley from the children's ward at Frimley Park Hospital in Surrey, having been a feature on the ward for over 30-years, it has started to show its age. Bookbinder Chris Shaw is given the task of repairing the daily diary kept by nurses and carers who took care of author and poet Michael Rosen while he was in a 40-day induced coma at the start of the pandemic. Dr Adrian and his daughter Lydia bring in a 1960s GP's bag that belonged to Adrian's late father Noel. Leather expert Suzie Fletcher teams up with silversmith Brenton West to repair the bag and the medical instruments inside. Will Kirk is tasked with revamping an old wooden desk that Bill saved from being thrown away when he was a student at nursing school in

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chelsea gold medal-winners Harry and David Rich descend on gardens in desperate need of a makeover - but must stick to the owners' budgets

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels have to climb a mountain to save Enid

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels discover the world of accessorising

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea tricks Supertato into thinking he has lost his powers

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: When Timmy sees a particularly grumpy farmer giving one of the flock a hard time, he decides to give him an idea of what it's like to be a sheep. However, when the time comes to have the old farmer back, things aren't quite so simple.

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: The gang enters Pieface into a comedy contest to make him realise how brilliantly funny he is

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: The kids wonder what they will be when they grow up

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: A huge creature eats a machine Ant created to clean a vast oceanic rubbish dump

programme.title: OOglies Funsize
programme.desc: The cavemen mushrooms hide from rampaging plant pots

programme.title: Game on Grandparents
programme.desc: Kai and Karen go head to head with Oscar and John as they compete for the chance to make it to the Grand Final and become ultimate champions

programme.title: One Zoo Three
programme.desc: The brothers find out how animals use vegetation to survive

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: A fan takeover of the show

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall heads to Gabon in search of crocodiles, chimpanzees and feisty elephants

programme.title: Pooch Perfect
programme.desc: Sheridan Smith presents as the second group of quarter-finalists give some scruffy bichons frisés their trademark white cloud look, and try to identify a cross-breed's two parents. In the final challenge, they must trim their dogs' coats to create a homage to a place close to their hearts, before showing off their creations on the Dogwalk. But who will judges Verity Hardcastle and Colin Taylor take through to next week?

programme.title: Undiscovered Worlds with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The explorer sets out to become the first person to reach the summit of a mountain in Greenland's Arctic wilderness. This already dangerous expedition is made all the more treacherous by the impact of climate change, as rising temperatures in the Arctic cause the ice sheets to melt. He must also brave rivers of freezing meltwater, quicksand, and treacherous glacial ice

programme.title: Rick Stein Tastes the Blues
programme.desc: The chef charts how the culinary and musical traditions of the Mississippi Delta have intertwined throughout history, and learns about the people who live along the river's banks. He visits restaurants, bars and famous concert venues to trace the stories of the region's colonial past and the famous musicians who shaped the evolution of the blues

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Cooking
programme.desc: The food writer makes a classic savoury pie with a puff pastry crust, and puts traditional pizza ingredients together in a new way to make an entirely original dish

programme.title: In Which We Serve (1942)
programme.desc: When a British destroyer is torpedoed during the Battle of Crete, surviving crew members are left clinging to the wreckage and recall their previous adventures at sea - and the reasons why they enlisted for service in the first place. Second World War drama, starring Noel Coward, who co-directed with David Lean, alongside John Mills, Bernard Miles, Celia Johnson and Richard Attenborough

programme.title: Escape to Athena (1979)
programme.desc: Second World War Allied PoWs incarcerated on a Greek island plan to defy the SS by breaking out of prison and pulling off an art robbery, with the help of their liberal-minded camp commandant. Action adventure, with Roger Moore, David Niven, Telly Savalas, Elliott Gould, Stefanie Powers and Claudia Cardinale

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking them to auction. Paul Martin presents

programme.title: Live International T20 Cricket
programme.desc: England v Australia. Coverage of the first of three T20s in the multi-format women's Ashes series, held at Edgbaston. Australia won two matches in this format during the 2021-22 series in the southern hemisphere, with the other contest abandoned due to rain, but England will hope for improved showings on home soil as they look for their first Ashes triumph since 2014. Four points were awarded for the winner of the Test match that opened the series at Trent Bridge, or two apiece if it was a draw, with two points handed to the victor in each of the T20s and three one-dayers that follow

programme.title: Later... with Jools Holland
programme.desc: The singer-songwriter performs with his band and a 16-piece string orchestra, playing tracks from new album Council Skies, including Pretty Boy, Open the Door, See What You Find and the title track, There also songs from the High Flying Birds and Oasis back catalogues, including a B-side that Noel has never performed live before. Noel also joins Jools for chats at the piano and looks back at his performances on the show over the years

programme.title: Reel Stories: Noel Gallagher
programme.desc: Dermot O'Leary chats to the singer about his life, showing clips of some of his most memorable TV appearances on shows including Top of the Pops, The Word and Newsnight. The programme looks back at Oasis' earliest TV appearances in the 1990s, the band's break-up, and his subsequent career with new band High Flying Birds

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: A special edition of the show featuring appearances by the band on the long-running music programme. First broadcast in 1998

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from day four of the Second Test in the five-match series, which comes from Lord's. The sides drew here in the last series on English soil in 2019, with Ben Stokes claiming the man of the match award after a second innings total of 115 put England in a commanding position. However, a half-century by the first concussion replacement in Test history Marnus Labuschagne helped the Aussies earn a draw

programme.title: Thanks for the Memories
programme.desc: Part one of two. Joyce is happy with her life, but everything is turned on its head when an accident requires a blood transfusion and she wakes up with memories that are not hers. Romantic comedy based on a novel by Cecelia Ahern, starring Tom Wlaschiha and Tamzin Merchant

programme.title: Thanks for the Memories
programme.desc: Joyce is happy staying with her father while her boyfriend Conor is in Brussels, but cannot understand why she can suddenly speak Italian. Noticing the unspoken attraction between her and Justin, Joyce's boss at the radio station invites him to an office outing at the karaoke evening in the local pub

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Weather forecaster Carol Kirkwood takes a journey through the world of horticulture, receiving inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters. The series progresses in alphabetical order, and this programme features themes beginning with the letter A, and includes archive material from Gardeners' World, Countryfile and The Gardener's Year

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives a masterclass on rambling, climbing and shrub roses. With The Hampton Court Garden Festival just around the corner in July, Carol is at home immersing herself in some of the plants she's growing for her highly ambitious show garden. And wildlife champion Kate Bradbury discovers a fascinating array of moths in her garden

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Adam Henson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Rare Breed Survival Trust, a charity founded by his father to reverse the decline of rare breed numbers in the UK. With summer temperatures rising, Adam welcomes a shearing gang on site to remove the coats of his commercial sheep, and is visited by the Chief Executive of the British Pig Association. Plus, a Gloucester Bull is prepared for a day at a country show

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: A report on the walled garden of Culzean Castle in South Ayrshire, alongsid advice from one of the show's regulars who now works as part of the team there. Carole Baxter visits a garden in Huntly, while at Beechgrove there is more information for beginners in the show's Back to Basics feature

programme.title: The Edible Garden
programme.desc: Alys Fowler demonstrates how to grow herbs and flowers and use them as ingredients in a selection of dishes, including herb omelettes, bread with rosemary and salads. She also reveals how they are important to attract wildlife to gardens, something essential to the health and productivity of any allotment

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge is joined by Ching-He Huang to discuss party food, with the chef putting her chicken and mushroom pies and spicy salmon rice balls up against the host's chicken nuggets and carrot-and-pistachio baklava. Resident expert Joe Wadsack has some unusual drinks suggestions for a special event, Oliver Peyton dons a lab coat to taste the ice-cream of the future and Kimberley Wilson heads to Europe's biggest barbecue festival

programme.title: Wimbledon 2022 Review
programme.desc: A look back at last year's championships at the All England Club. Novak Djokovic was looking for a third successive title, while a new ladies' champion was crowned following 2021 winner Ashleigh Barty's retirement. Fans and former champions also paid tribute to Sue Barker as she stepped down after 30 years as the BBC's lead presenter

programme.title: This Beautiful Fantastic (2016)
programme.desc: A young woman who dreams of being a children's author forges an unlikely friendship with a cantankerous, rich old widower, as well as his housekeeper and an inventor who frequents the library where she works. Drama, starring Jessica Brown Findlay, Tom Wilkinson, Andrew Scott and Jeremy Irvine

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: In Children's week, Sara Pascoe invites the seven remaining sewers to create a dragon dressing gown using thick towelling fabric and including tricky details like dragon spikes, neat binding and a googly-eyed hood. In the Transformation Challenge, the sewers personalise some hand-me-down denim jackets before welcoming some mini-models for the Made to Measure challenge in which the contestants make a party-ready outfit for a five-year-old

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: IT project manager Lee and actor Darren remodel their 1960s house in Southampton, after choosing a design using virtual reality. Architects Laura Jane Clark and Damion Burrows go head to head pitching their unique designs to the couple, with Laura Jane drawing inspiration from the property's original features and Damion planning to open up the house, giving it a better connection to the garden

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: The BAUHAUS-galan. Live coverage of the seventh meeting of the campaign, held at Stockholm Olympic Stadium. The meeting records fell in the men's and women's 400m hurdles last year, with Alison dos Santos and Femke Bol the respective victors. This time around, the men's high jump will be highly anticipated, with Gianmarco Tamberi and Mutaz Essa Barshim, who shared Olympic gold in Tokyo, set to go head-to-head for the first time this year

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the fifth and final day of the Second Test in the five-match series, which came from Lord's. Australia won an eventful opener at Edgbaston by two wickets, with England impressing at times with their aggressive play, but the more measured approach of Aussie batsman Usman Khawaja helping his side to victory with innings of 141 and 65

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Part two of two. Colin Stafford-Johnson encounters bats emerging from a labyrinth of limestone caves to feed on nectar from giant hibiscus flowers, and tiny frogs, smaller than a fingernail, living in patches of hidden emerald forest. Meanwhile, on the white sand beaches, baby green turtles emerge from their nests to make their way to the Caribbean sea. Colin also sees how the modern world is impacting this island paradise, meeting endangered Cuban Crocodiles as well as parrots under pressure from habitat loss

programme.title: Bridge of Spies (2015)
programme.desc: A lawyer in 1950s New York is hired to represent a Soviet spy in a showcase trial designed to demonstrate the fairness of the US justice system. In the face of public condemnation, he argues against the death penalty, a stance that years later leads to his involvement in an exchange of prisoners in East Germany. Steven Spielberg's fact-based Cold War drama, starring Tom Hanks and an Oscar-winning Mark Rylance

programme.title: The Misinvestigations of Romesh Ranganathan
programme.desc: The comedian attempts to resolve the mysterious death of American rock star Jimi Hendrix, who was found dead in a Notting Hill flat in September 1970, with criminal psychologists and private detectives helping him dig deep into the case

programme.title: The Trouble with Kanye
programme.desc: Award-winning journalist Mobeen Azhar investigates one of music's most troubling stories. Unfolding against the backdrop of Ye's recent behaviour and his rumoured 2024 presidential campaign, this documentary sees Azhar travel to the United States to try to discover how one of America's most celebrated artists has been accused of spreading hate and division. Tracing a line from earlier controversies in his career to this current moment, Mobeen speaks to Dr Marcus Hunter about the impact of some of Ye's earlier statements, and explores the bigger picture- a surge of white nationalism and antisemitism across America and the world

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents topical debate from Exeter. This week's panel comprises Health and Social Care Minister Helen Whately MP, Shadow Mental Health Minister Dr Rosena Allin-Khan MP, the Scottish National Party's Deputy Leader at Westminster Mhairi Black MP, Daily Telegraph columnist Dia Chakravarty and the chef and campaigner Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall

programme.title: Africa Rising with Afua Hirsch
programme.desc: The energy and ambition of young creatives in Nigeria, asking what drives their success in everything from music to film-making. Afua meets Ayobami Adebayo, award-winning author and rising star of the Lagos literary scene. She also discovers how designer Adeju Thompson is blazing a trail with his non-binary clothes label Lagos Space Programme, cooks giant snails with Nigerian chef Obehi Ekhomu-El Herfi and talks African music with singer Mádé Kuti - the grandson of Afrobeat legend Fela Kuti

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from Ardingly in West Sussex, and finds out about a wildlife collection put together by a Victorian naturalist. With experts Jonathan Pratt and Ochuko Ojiri

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from London's Docklands to the Barbican, examining the story of the arrival at Tilbury in 1948 of the Empire Windrush, which brought more than a thousand passengers from the Caribbean to work in Britain. In Limehouse, Michael reflects on the Labour Party's landslide victory at the post-war general election of 1945 and hears what drove new prime minister Clement Attlee to strive for social change

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: With plenty of fledglings, Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan are keeping up with the comings and goings at RSPB Arne in Dorset. Megan McCubbin revels in a botany bonanza at Durlston Country Park, a national nature reserve on the Isle of Purbeck, which in the spring is simply buzzing with life, while Gillian Burke heads to Anglesey

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the opening day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Emma Raducanu delighted the home crowd on Centre Court on day one last year, with the 2021 US Open winner prevailing 6-4, 6-4 against Belgium's Alison Van Uytvanck. She was followed by another hugely popular player here in two-time champion Andy Murray, who triumphed 4-6, 6-3, 6-2, 6-4 against Australian James Duckworth, and there was further British success over on the No. 2 Court, with Cameron Norrie beating Spain's Pablo Andujar 6-0, 7-6, 6-3. On the No. 1 Court, there was a 6-0, 7-5 victory for Germany's 2018 champion Angelique Kerber against Kristina Mladenovic of France

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the opening day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kim's anxiety soars on the day of her sentencing and Howie confides in Denise. Stacey and Martin worry about Lily who is suddenly not feeling well just before the family conference. Elaine asks the Knight girls to be her bridesmaids

programme.title: Your Body Uncovered with Kate Garraway
programme.desc: Kate meets Judith, a singer who has been delaying treatment for a thyroid nodule for fear it may damage her voice and in turn her career. She hopes a three dimensional look at the growth in her neck will help her understand why surgery is the best option to treat her condition. Elsewhere, Kate meets Melina, whose love for good food has been curtailed because of agonising gallstone attacks

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Qasa Alom presents highlights of the opening day's play at the All England Club, where the first round got under way in the men's and ladies' singles. Novak Djokovic was scheduled on Centre Court to begin the defence of the title he won in the last four stagings of the event

programme.title: Dry Your Eyes
programme.desc: Northern Irish comedy sketch show, featuring a woman obsessed with calling the police for trivial reasons, and a needy checkout girl who cannot cope with rejection - even if it's just the offer of a loyalty card. Plus, a parody of Line of Duty, in which a Northern Irish detective based in England can always get a confession by being incomprehensible to his suspects

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Beguiled (2017)
programme.desc: A girls' school in Confederate Virginia continues running through the American Civil War, but the peaceful order is disturbed by the arrival of an injured Union deserter. The soldier is taken in for medical treatment, but his presence inspires jealousy, betrayal and desire among teachers and students alike. Period drama based on the novel by Thomas Cullinan, starring Colin Farrell, Nicole Kidman and Kirsten Dunst

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Adam Henson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Rare Breed Survival Trust, a charity founded by his father to reverse the decline of rare breed numbers in the UK. With summer temperatures rising, Adam welcomes a shearing gang on site to remove the coats of his commercial sheep, and is visited by the Chief Executive of the British Pig Association. Plus, a Gloucester Bull is prepared for a day at a country show

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: The school launches its new radio station and Danny uses it as a chance to try to make amends. Myles's actions catch up with him and he is alienated by his peers. Nicky butts heads with Kai while she battles with guilt and Preston is forced to face his demons

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: Rav Wilding investigates the noise-detecting cameras being used to tackle anti-social drivers, the importance of fingerprint evidence and how 3D graphics are used in courtrooms

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Caribbean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon meets the owner of a traditional wooden house in Barbados who has turned down millions of dollars from luxury property developers, then encounters marijuana growers on the volcanic island of St Vincent hoping that the drug will soon be decriminalised. On the South American mainland, Simon examines the mismanagement of Venezuela's natural resources, before crossing into Colombia, where he spends time with the Kogi - an indigenous people who have maintained their traditional forest lifestyle

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc: Paul Rose visits Ecuador to examine the tale of an 18th-century expedition in which a group of French intellectuals set out to determine the shape of the Earth. The mission was beset by problems from the start as disease, disputes and affairs set the explorers on separate paths and, while great discoveries were made, the team was still to face theft, death and despair

programme.title: Beck
programme.desc: The crime drama returns but things have changed, with Beck promoted to chief, while Alexandra leads the investigative work at the station. Vilhelm Beck, Martin's grandson, is out on a mission with his supervisor when, in a routine case, he finds a dead 17-year-old boy at the crime scene. It immediately becomes a case for Alex, Martin and the others in the team. In Swedish

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Gavin Campbell, Julian Clary, Polly James, Danny La Rue, Rose-Marie and Jane Marie Osborne fill in the blanks on this March 1990 edition of the light-hearted game show

programme.title: Parkinson: The Interviews
programme.desc: In a programme first broadcast in 1995, Michael Parkinson looks back at memorable moments from his interviews with actor Kenneth Williams. Among other topics, the Carry On star discusses his dislike of theatre critics, and reveals his grievances with Parkinson himself. He also performs a rendition of My Crepes Suzette. With appearances by John Betjeman, Maggie Smith, Frank Muir, Tom Lehrer, Robin Ray and Patrick Campbell

programme.title: Comic Roots
programme.desc: A 1983 documentary in which Kenneth Williams explores his roots, including the slum architecture in and around London's St Pancras district where he grew up, his grandma's fruity anecdotes and the musical knees-up of the local pub

programme.title: Hancock's Half Hour
programme.desc: The comedian has to share his hotel room with a yodeller and a horn player, and is then arrested and thrown into a cell with Kenneth Williams

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Thelma looks on with disapproval as Terry helps Bob move his most treasured possessions to his new house, releasing a flood of nostalgic memories about their youthful misadventures. Comedy, starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam

programme.title: Caribbean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon meets the owner of a traditional wooden house in Barbados who has turned down millions of dollars from luxury property developers, then encounters marijuana growers on the volcanic island of St Vincent hoping that the drug will soon be decriminalised. On the South American mainland, Simon examines the mismanagement of Venezuela's natural resources, before crossing into Colombia, where he spends time with the Kogi - an indigenous people who have maintained their traditional forest lifestyle

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc: Paul Rose visits Ecuador to examine the tale of an 18th-century expedition in which a group of French intellectuals set out to determine the shape of the Earth. The mission was beset by problems from the start as disease, disputes and affairs set the explorers on separate paths and, while great discoveries were made, the team was still to face theft, death and despair

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: The chef visits Vienna, the city that once ran the Austro-Hungarian Empire and continues to be home to comfort dishes such as tafelspitz and goulash, and which gave its name to one of Europe's most popular dishes - the Wiener schnitzel. Rick learns the essential etiquette to the Austrian capital's coffee house culture and indulges in its sweet tooth by enjoying a plate or two of apple strudel and Sacher torte. He also finds time to enjoy the traditional music of the country, typically Mozart and Strauss

programme.title: Summer Night Concert from Vienna
programme.desc: The Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra present their traditional summer night concert from the grounds of Schoenbrunn Palace, conducted for the first time by maestro Yannick Nézet-Séguin. Highlights include soloist Elina Garanca singing three arias from Georges Bizet's Carmen, Charles Gounod's Sapho and Camille Saint-Saëns' Samson et Dalila

programme.title: Vienna: Empire, Dynasty and Dream
programme.desc: Historian Simon Sebag Montefiore describes how the Habsburgs transformed Vienna into a multinational city of music, culture, art and ideas. Simon explores the Habsburgs' rise to power and discovers more about how Vienna marked Europe's front line in the struggle to defend both Christendom and the Catholic Church from revolutionaries who plotted to destroy them

programme.title: Britain's Ancient Capital: Secrets of Orkney
programme.desc: An investigation into how recent archaeological finds on the archipelago indicate that Orkney was the cultural capital of Stone Age Britain and the birthplace of the stone circle cult. Chris Packham uncovers the secrets revealed by the DNA of Orkney's unique vole, Neil Oliver explores tombs and monuments, Shini Somara experiments to discover how ancient Orcadians could have moved giant blocks of stone over rough ground, and Andy Torbet climbs a challenging sea-stack to unlock the story of Orkney's unusual geology

programme.title: Magic Numbers: Hannah Fry's Mysterious World of Maths
programme.desc: Mathematician Dr Hannah Fry explores the mystery of maths. In the opening episode, Hannah begins her journey looking at whether maths was invented or discovered, and examines rules of maths found in nature from flower petals to a virus structure, as well as the invention of zero and other imaginary numbers

programme.title: Summer Night Concert from Vienna
programme.desc: The Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra present their traditional summer night concert from the grounds of Schoenbrunn Palace, conducted for the first time by maestro Yannick Nézet-Séguin. Highlights include soloist Elina Garanca singing three arias from Georges Bizet's Carmen, Charles Gounod's Sapho and Camille Saint-Saëns' Samson et Dalila

programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: The chef visits Vienna, the city that once ran the Austro-Hungarian Empire and continues to be home to comfort dishes such as tafelspitz and goulash, and which gave its name to one of Europe's most popular dishes - the Wiener schnitzel. Rick learns the essential etiquette to the Austrian capital's coffee house culture and indulges in its sweet tooth by enjoying a plate or two of apple strudel and Sacher torte. He also finds time to enjoy the traditional music of the country, typically Mozart and Strauss

programme.title: The Wonder of Bees with Martha Kearney
programme.desc: The journalist reflects on the success of her mission to harvest true wildflower honey as she offers her wares to the public at a village fair, before she concludes her year-long beekeeping adventure with a visit to Cornwall's Tregothnan Estate - where she discovers the secrets of the highly prized manuka honey

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Made in Britain
programme.desc: Fred navigates Snowdonia and the Llanberis Pass, before starting his journey from Bolton to Buckingham Palace to collect his MBE

programme.title: Attenborough and the Giant Dinosaur
programme.desc: The story of how more than 220 dinosaur bones were found in the Argentinean desert, which were found to have come from a previously undiscovered species, which is the largest land dwelling animal known to have existed. David Attenborough visits the archaeological dig and a laboratory where the remains are being cleaned and analysed with lead scientist Dr Diego Pol and evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod, and meets animators, model-makers, paleontologists and anatomy experts who are working to reconstruct what the 37 metre-long creature would have looked like

programme.title: Secrets of the Jurassic Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Part two of two. Liz Bonnin joins the palaeontologists as they unearth the remains of fearsome Jurassic predators, with the team considering if the site was a dinosaur hunting ground. They try to figure out if these predators were involved in the deaths of supersized beasts like the diplodocus buried at the site, helping to reveal why so many dinosaurs came here, and what killed them in such great numbers 150 million years ago

programme.title: Planet Dinosaur
programme.desc: The documentary series reaches the Cretaceous period, 75 million years ago, when Earth was dominated by the last generation of gigantic carnivores that took killing to a new level. They included the daspletosaurus, which hunted in gangs and used its highly developed smell and hearing to take down opponents like the horned rhino-sized chasmosuarus. Also featured is the sharp-toothed majungasaurus, a predator of much smaller creatures that would occasionally turn cannibal and hunt its own kind

programme.title: Planet Dinosaur
programme.desc: The documentary series reaches the Jurassic period, when the first giant killers stalked Earth and lurked in the seas. North America was dominated by the allosaurus, an ambush hunter with a lethal bite, allowing it to bring down even the heavily armoured stegosaurus. Life in the oceans was just as deadly - a fossil found in the Arctic in 2008 turned out to be a colossal marine reptile. Named Predator X, the creature was 50ft long, weighed 45 tons and had a bite force unmatched by anything in the Jurassic seas

programme.title: Walking with Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Water-dwelling giants of the late Jurassic period, when the Earth's coastlines were reshaped by a steady rise in sea levels and thousands of square miles of land were flooded. These shallow seas supported a revolution in marine life, and reptiles such as plesiosaurs shared the water with liopleurodon, the largest carnivore on the planet

programme.title: Walking with Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Flying reptiles from the early Cretaceous period, known as pterosaurs, which had small bodies and hollow bones, and flew by means of wings covered with a membrane. Most pterosaurs could stay airborne under their own power, but the largest ones, with a wingspan of up to 11 metres, probably relied on thermal currents

programme.title: Magic Numbers: Hannah Fry's Mysterious World of Maths
programme.desc: Dr Hannah Fry travels down the fastest zip-wire in the world to learn more about Newton's ideas on gravity and discusses why maths is so good at predicting the world around us

programme.title: The Wonder of Bees with Martha Kearney

Then, the teams must work out which season James is talking about by standing under the correct tree. If they’re correct, they’ll get covered in spring blossom, summer sunlight, autumn leaves or winter snow! Finally, a player from each team must memorise a pattern of animals on the Memory Path, before guiding their partner across it. In the lab, Sam, Ayo and James complete a quiz to find out which animals they share qualities with. But who is the eagle, the herring gull or the dung beetle?

Glitch is determined to win Wimbledon, but he is not adhering to any of the rules, and the umpire wants him to leave. Glitch is staying put until he can play some tennis and win the tournament, so Kyan and Xuli head on to Centre Court to take him on

programme.title: Apple Tree House
programme.desc: Sam and Bella are back from their summer holidays. Sam's hoping Mali got all the postcards she sent, but he's nowhere to be seen. Worried that Mali's sad because he had to stay at Apple Tree House all summer, they hunt around for him believing that he'll need cheering up

programme.title: Andy's Safari Adventures
programme.desc: Mr Hammond has asked Andy to give a talk all about elephant shrews. Jetting off in his safari-mobile, Andy heads to the African Savannah in search of the tiny creature and discovers amazing facts about it. Along the way, he meets a dung beetle, comes face to face with a hungry monitor lizard and narrowly escapes a herd of stampeding animals

programme.title: Swashbuckle
programme.desc: Gem and her teams of Swashbucklers try to win her jewels back from pirates Cook, Line and Sinker. Game show for children

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The dog decides to make an omelette, but there are no eggs in the basket, so he tries to find out where all the chickens are

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: The predators come up with a plan to get rid of Peter Rabbit because they are tired of being constantly humiliated

programme.title: Andy's Safari Adventures
programme.desc: Disaster strikes at Safari World when Andy accidentally breaks a bowerbird nest that Mr Hammond was going to put on display

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The underwater explorers study a group of baby hammerhead sharks as they hunt on their own for the first time and poke their noses into trouble

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bingo uses her 'dance mode' wishes on her dad!

programme.title: Bluey

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea steals Tomato's precious jewel and Supertato tries to get it back

programme.title: Molly and Mack
programme.desc: Molly examines her shelf of special things at the back of Mack’s stall. She chooses the ‘Very Berry Delights’ pot and remembers the day she got it. Bob has a big order from Mrs Juniper for berries, but the birds keep stealing them from his allotment and he’s about to run out! Meanwhile, Mrs Juniper is proudly selling her ‘Very Berry Delights’ in little pots. Moira’s too busy to have one as she’s having a clearout. Just as she’s about to recycle some old clothes, Kez approaches and says she will find a use for them. Ruby has an idea to help Bob’s berry crisis – they should make a scarecrow! They soon realise that they need clothes for it, so James asks Kez if she has anything suitable and she gives him the box of Moira’s old clothes. Later, at the allotment, the scarecrow is ready - until Bob and James realise the scarecrow is wearing Moira’s old clothes and looks exactly like her. They aren’t too worried as she never comes to the allotment. Back at the Big Hub, Moira has finally found

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: George gets locked inside Mrs Hobbs' house and Waffle has a chance to prove himself to Mrs Hobbs. Can he rescue George?

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: Flamingo and John give Sarah and Duck a tour of their home and invite them to play their favourite game

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: JoJo and Gran Gran have their own carnival in the garden to celebrate St Lucia.

programme.title: Moon and Me
programme.desc: When Pepi Nana loses her red pencil, Little Nana finds it under the wardrobe. Because she is small, Little Nana sees things that Pepi Nana might not see. The two friends go for a walk, and along the way Little Nana shows Pepi Nana lots of new things

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: Tiny and Small discover the froglets sitting abnormally silent and calm in their cave, in front of three stones which glow blue and emit an unearthly sound. Major Clanger think these must be 'hush stones' however the effect is anything but calming

programme.title: PS I Love You (2007)
programme.desc: Widowed Holly feels she cannot cope following the death of her husband. However, on her birthday, she receives a letter he wrote to her just before he died, encouraging her to live life to the full rather than languish in sorrow. This is just the first in a series of messages, each one sending her on wild misadventures and helping her to move on. Romantic drama based on Cecelia Ahern's novel, starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler and Lisa Kudrow

programme.desc: A music lover in 1970s Belfast opens a record shop while his city is torn apart by the Troubles. Fact-based drama, starring Richard Dormer, Jodie Whittaker, Liam Cunningham and Dylan Moran

programme.desc: Chris Bavin helps a couple to find a new home in rural Shropshire, and also meets a local chef who uses seasonal, local food, much of which he forages for himself

programme.title: Finding Dory (2016)
programme.desc: Young clownfish Nemo and his dad Marlin set out on an underwater adventure to help their forgetful friend Dory find her parents, meeting the grouchy but well-meaning octopus Hank along the way. Pixar animated sequel, featuring the voices of Ellen DeGeneres, Albert Brooks and Ed O'Neill

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: Derek Brockway walks the Clywedog Valley Trail near Wrexham in North Wales. He learns the story of John Wilkinson, known as Iron Mad Jack, who revolutionised the iron industry and helps carve a duck from a cedar log. Meanwhile, wildlife expert Lizzie Daly discovers red squirrels are on a comeback in the area and Onkar Singh Purewal is blown away by the rare varieties of apples being grown on the National Trust's Erddig Estate

programme.title: Wynne's Welsh 70s
programme.desc: Wynne Evans delves into the BBC Wales archive of 1978, remembering the wet summer, the start of Radio Wales and Ray Reardon's World Snooker Championship win. Other highlights include weird and wonderful dancing potatoes, cowboys in mid Wales and Aberystwuth actor Gareth Thomas leading the TV sci-fi adventure Blake's 7. Plus, a seal-hugging police officer, Betty Campbell in Tiger Bay and Shakin' Stevens in colour

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Maleficent: Mistress of Evil (2019)
programme.desc: Aurora's impending marriage to Prince Phillip is cause for celebration in the kingdom of Ulstead and the neighbouring Moors, as the wedding serves to unite the two worlds. But Maleficent and her god-daughter begin to question the complex family ties that bind them as they are pulled in different directions. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Angelina Jolie and Elle Fanning, with Michelle Pfeiffer and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven and Margherita Taylor travel to the village of Charsfield in Suffolk to celebrate acclaimed rural writer Ronald Blythe, who died in January aged 100. They visit key locations of his work and explore traditional crafts. Margherita talks to nature writer Melissa Harrison, who was inspired to move to the region by Blythe's works, and John meets a proud Suffolk speaker who explains how the dialect evolved

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Powis Castle, one of the grandest houses in Wales, where treasures include a valuable oil painting depicting Scottish islands which was bought from a charity shop for £20, a ring crafted from a swan's feather woven with gold that has survived for over 300 years, and a ventriloquist's dummy. Plus, Runjeet Singh challenges Fiona to put three exquisitely designed ceremonial Indian weapons in order of value

programme.title: Legends of Welsh Sport
programme.desc: A profile of the rugby star, who was born in Cardiff to Windrush generation parents and witnessed racism at first hand, but made sporting history by scoring three tries at the inaugural Rugby World Cup in 1987. He also became a role model for players like Gareth Thomas who dared to be different

programme.title: Rookie Nurses
programme.desc: Leah is faced with her biggest challenge yet when one of her patients confesses that he wants to die. Angelo tries to keep up with a ward full of patients and Mikey thinks he has seen it all until a man comes in to A&E after being run over by his wife. Gina and Issie reflect on the huge progress their stroke patients have made

programme.title: Mary Queen of Scots (2018)
programme.desc: Following the death of her husband, Queen Mary returns to Scotland after years reigning in France. Despite religious differences, she hopes to achieve peace with her English cousin, Queen Elizabeth I. However, Mary Stuart's eventual attempt to overthrow Elizabeth finds her condemned to years of imprisonment. Director Josie Rourke's drama, starring Saoirse Ronan, Margot Robbie and David Tennant

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A man narrowly escapes death in a remote ravine after his dog alerts local walkers of his plight, and a car enthusiast faces dire consequences when he buys back a favourite motor

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate helps put a lion pride into another lion's territory to analyse the current social structure. The keepers carry out essential health checks on the park's new red pandas

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell visit a three-bedroom terrace in Rugby, a former working men's club in Bolsover and a three bedroom semi in Nottingham which are all up for sale at online auctions. The team follows progress on building work to see if any of the developers can turn a profit on their investments

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents today's show from Hele in Devon, and visits a Victorian catacomb. The reds and the blues are led by John Cameron and Stephanie Connell

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the opening day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Novak Djokovic will be first up on Centre Court, having won his fourth consecutive title here and his seventh overall after overcoming Nick Kyrgios in the 2022 final. Having already won the Australian and French Opens this year, Djokovic is aiming to become the first man since Rod Laver in 1969 to win all four Grand Slam events in the same year. One of his main challengers could well be Carlos Alcaraz, who is the last man other than Djokovic to win a Grand Slam, having won the US Open in 2022, which contributed to a spell at the top of the world rankings

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the opening day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. In the ladies' competition, there were straight-set victories for eventual runner-up Ons Jabeur and second seed Anett Kontaveit over MIrjam Bjorklund and Bernarda Pera on day one last year. In the men's event, Wimbledon continued to be the one Grand Slam that has eluded Stan Wawrinka, when he lost 7-5, 4-6, 6-3, 6-2 to a man 17 years his junior in Jannik Sinner

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: After 15 years of fostering, Stephen and Lynn Smedley were looking forward to their well-earned retirement in Carbis Bay, Cornwall. However, the dream dramatically changed when their daughter died, leaving them caring for their three grandsons. The boys, still grieving for their mum's untimely death, are forced to share a single bedroom with a triple bunkbed. There is only one bathroom and Lynn is forced to do the ironing in the shed due to lack of space. Enter Nick Knowles and the team. Their plan is to reconfigure and enlarge their home to accommodate three growing boys - with the help of hundreds of volunteers

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: We Hunt Together
programme.desc: Lola and Jackson find one thing they can agree on after interviewing Freddy. Freddy and Baba seize upon an opportunity to solve two problems with another killing

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team celebrate the 75th anniversary of the National Health Service by restoring items chronicling the evolution of the publicly funded healthcare system. First into the barn are nurses Catherine and Katie who bring metal-man Dominic Chinea a Thomas the Tank Engine food trolley from the children's ward at Frimley Park Hospital in Surrey, having been a feature on the ward for over 30-years, it has started to show its age. Bookbinder Chris Shaw is given the task of repairing the daily diary kept by nurses and carers who took care of author and poet Michael Rosen while he was in a 40-day induced coma at the start of the pandemic. Dr Adrian and his daughter Lydia bring in a 1960s GP's bag that belonged to Adrian's late father Noel. Leather expert Suzie Fletcher teams up with silversmith Brenton West to repair the bag and the medical instruments inside. Will Kirk is tasked with revamping an old wooden desk that Bill saved from being thrown away when he was a student at nursing school in

programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chelsea gold medal-winners Harry and David Rich descend on gardens in desperate need of a makeover - but must stick to the owners' budgets

However, Mary Stuart's eventual attempt to overthrow Elizabeth finds her condemned to years of imprisonment. Director Josie Rourke's drama, starring Saoirse Ronan, Margot Robbie and David Tennant

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the opening day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Novak Djokovic will be first up on Centre Court, having won his fourth consecutive title here and his seventh overall after overcoming Nick Kyrgios in the 2022 final. Having already won the Australian and French Opens this year, Djokovic is aiming to become the first man since Rod Laver in 1969 to win all four Grand Slam events in the same year. One of his main challengers could well be Carlos Alcaraz, who is the last man other than Djokovic to win a Grand Slam, having won the US Open in 2022, which contributed to a spell at the top of the world rankings

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the opening day from the All England Club, featuring the first round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. In the ladies' competition, there were straight-set victories for eventual runner-up Ons Jabeur and second seed Anett Kontaveit over MIrjam Bjorklund and Bernarda Pera on day one last year. In the men's event, Wimbledon continued to be the one Grand Slam that has eluded Stan Wawrinka, when he lost 7-5, 4-6, 6-3, 6-2 to a man 17 years his junior in Jannik Sinner

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: After 15 years of fostering, Stephen and Lynn Smedley were looking forward to their well-earned retirement in Carbis Bay, Cornwall. However, the dream dramatically changed when their daughter died, leaving them caring for their three grandsons. The boys, still grieving for their mum's untimely death, are forced to share a single bedroom with a triple bunkbed. There is only one bathroom and Lynn is forced to do the ironing in the shed due to lack of space. Enter Nick Knowles and the team. Their plan is to reconfigure and enlarge their home to accommodate three growing boys - with the help of hundreds of volunteers

programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Paul Ainsworth and Angela Hartnett, plus special guest Les Dennis. Helen McGinn picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Nadiya Bakes
programme.desc: In the third episode, Nadiya Hussain shares some of her favourite savoury dishes, including a chicken and pink peppercorn pie, and simple, baked teriyaki noodles which are the perfect fuss-free midweek meal. Nadiya also demonstrates how to make a tear and share bread loaf with all the flavours of a pizza

programme.title: Tennis: Eastbourne
programme.desc: The Rothesay International Eastbourne Tennis Tournament. Live coverage of the final of the women's grass court tournament from Devonshire Park Lawn Tennis Club. Two-time Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova took the honours here last year, prevailing 6-3, 6-2 against 2-17 French Open-winner Jelena Ostapenko

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph presents the show from High Wycombe recycling centre, where the experts set to work restoring a pine wardrobe, a pair of old sun loungers, and two metal garden chairs

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A young Essex couple need Nicki Chapman's help to find them a new home in Somerset. Nicki also visits a local farm to sample some homemade specialities made from an ancient grain

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public, including an anatomy model, a set of antique printing drawers and a 1950s toy telephone

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Kim's relatives live all over the world, and when they do visit, they avoid gathering in Kim's tired, unloved garden. This prompts Flo Headlam and Charlie Dimmock to head to Luton, Bedfordshire, to create a cottage garden for Kim who has a budget of £4,000 to make the most of the outdoor space

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present a music-based quiz show in which contestants must name as many hit songs and artists as possible under intense pressure, with a £10,000 jackpot up for grabs. Across three rounds, best friends from Reading and Norfolk, a mother and daughter from London and siblings from Belfast have their knowledge put to the test

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the Saturday-night game show, as contestants take on a colossal spinning wheel and answer questions in the hope of securing a cash prize. Helping today's contestants out are Claudia Winkleman, Big Narstie, Alex Brooker, Gabby Logan, Debbie McGee, Jamie Laing and Patrick Grant

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz, as Jamie Laing, James Argent, Griff Rhys Jones, Nina Wadia, Lee Latchford Evans, Claire Richards, Sindhu Vee and Tiff Stevenson try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Rumours of Jodie's apparent affair with Max spiral out of control, forcing her to resign. However, her leaving party ends in disaster when the pub explodes. Donna struggles to keep control of the new nurses and worries she isn't a good enough role model for them, but Rida and Cam prove her wrong

programme.title: Champion
programme.desc: Drama created by bestselling novelist Candice Carty-Williams, about the rivalry between brother and sister rappers. Talented songwriter Vita supports her brother Bosco as he strives to rebuild his musical career following a prison sentence. However, she comes to realise he will never appreciate what she does for him, and decides to strike out on her own as a solo artist. Starring Déja J Bowens and Malcolm Kamulete

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: PS I Love You (2007)
programme.desc: Widowed Holly feels she cannot cope following the death of her husband. However, on her birthday, she receives a letter he wrote to her just before he died, encouraging her to live life to the full rather than languish in sorrow. This is just the first in a series of messages, each one sending her on wild misadventures and helping her to move on. Romantic drama based on Cecelia Ahern's novel, starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler and Lisa Kudrow

programme.title: Good Vibrations (2012)
programme.desc: A music lover in 1970s Belfast opens a record shop while his city is torn apart by the Troubles. His business introduces him to the city's underground punk scene, and he becomes one of the key figures in creating an alternative subculture to the violence around him. Fact-based drama, starring Richard Dormer, Jodie Whittaker, Liam Cunningham and Dylan Moran

programme.title: Points of View

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Chris Bavin helps a couple to find a new home in rural Shropshire, and also meets a local chef who uses seasonal, local food, much of which he forages for himself

programme.title: Finding Dory (2016)
programme.desc: Young clownfish Nemo and his dad Marlin set out on an underwater adventure to help their forgetful friend Dory find her parents, meeting the grouchy but well-meaning octopus Hank along the way. Pixar animated sequel, featuring the voices of Ellen DeGeneres, Albert Brooks and Ed O'Neill

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: The final episode explores the challenges that ocean life must overcome, including baby elephant seals and humpback whales endangered as their mothers end up surrounded by males vying for supremacy. A lone sealion chases tuna, one of the fastest fish in the ocean. Not only must it find a way of catching this enormous fish, but it must do so whilst fighting off hungry sharks

programme.title: Maleficent: Mistress of Evil (2019)
programme.desc: Aurora's impending marriage to Prince Phillip is cause for celebration in the kingdom of Ulstead and the neighbouring Moors, as the wedding serves to unite the two worlds. But Maleficent and her god-daughter begin to question the complex family ties that bind them as they are pulled in different directions. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Angelina Jolie and Elle Fanning, with Michelle Pfeiffer and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven and Margherita Taylor travel to the village of Charsfield in Suffolk to celebrate acclaimed rural writer Ronald Blythe, who died in January aged 100. They visit key locations of his work and explore traditional crafts. Margherita talks to nature writer Melissa Harrison, who was inspired to move to the region by Blythe's works, and John meets a proud Suffolk speaker who explains how the dialect evolved

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Powis Castle, one of the grandest houses in Wales, where treasures include a valuable oil painting depicting Scottish islands which was bought from a charity shop for £20, a ring crafted from a swan's feather woven with gold that has survived for over 300 years, and a ventriloquist's dummy. Plus, Runjeet Singh challenges Fiona to put three exquisitely designed ceremonial Indian weapons in order of value
