This edition features Ryan, from Hull. Born with cystic fibrosis, the 24-year-old martial arts instructor is hoping to meet someone who shares his desire to live life to the max

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: In an edition first shown in November 2018, the sofa critics review The Heist, Strictly Come Dancing, Dynasties, They Shall Not Grow Old, Extreme Everest with Ant Middleton, First Dates, and What Lies Beneath

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Laboratory engineer Daniel, 39, attempts to keep his nerves under control when he meets 29-year-old lingerie designer Lauren, while six foot three firefighter Nikki hopes rugby player Ross will sweep her off her feet. Call centre worker Zoe, 21, is looking for an intelligent and ladylike bookworm and sits down for a meal with Grace, a well-read 22-year-old physics student with a penchant for grammatical correctness, and HR adviser Leah, 34, is matched with 37-year-old blue-eyed boy Andy from Middlesbrough

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: Joe, Sal, Q and Murr take on their most challenging dare yet, an epic highwire walk five stories above New York City during the show's first punishment extravaganza

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Britain's Got Talent, Scared of the Dark, Obsession, Family Fortunes, The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up To Cancer, Love Is Blind, Inside the Factory and BBC news coverage of the nurses' strikes

programme.title: Below Deck Sailing Yacht
programme.desc: After a wild night out, the hungover Parsifal crew put the pieces of the night back together as they prepare for the second charter of the season

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef again comes to the aid of failing American restaurants, starting in Fishtown, Philadelphia, where he tries to help the three owners of the Hot Potato Cafe, which has not made a profit in two years. Spurred on by a scathing review by an influential critic, he makes radical changes to alter the staff's attitudes and create food that is up to his own exacting standards

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Malcolm and Marty find themselves on the same dating app and vying for the same woman's attention. Gemma has her car repaired at Calvin's garage

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: When Gemma decides to fire a teacher at her school, she is unprepared for the aftermath. Calvin gets a surprise when he faces off with his newspaper carrier

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty finds out about a threat to British juniper berries that could spell the end of gin's recent resurgence, while Kate Quilton heads to Hawaii to find out why macadamia nuts are not sold in their shells. Matt Tebbutt investigates the possible health risks caused by his habit of going back for a second dip in a communal salsa with a tortilla chip that's already been in his mouth

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Tracy from Southport wishes to find the perfect country property, which she can one day turn into a B&B. She's always dreamed of relocating to France and after a recent divorce feels that now is the right time to do it. With a budget of £100,000, Jonnie Irwin sets out to find the ideal place for her

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Retired civil servant Marie can't wait to leave the London rat race and make a permanent move to Poitou Charentes, France, with the new additions to her family - four adopted cats. As son Alex plans to visit mum as much as he can, he's come along too. Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties within Marie's £110,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Paul and Sue from Kent have just celebrated their fifth wedding anniversary and think that now's the perfect time to fulfil their dream of buying a holiday home in France. They're searching for an idyllic property in Normandy, a close enough drive from the UK for them, their family and their two dogs. Danni Menzies shows them five options to consider

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with two pairs of house-hunters. Chris and Nicola from Hastings were newlyweds searching for their dream home nine years ago, while couple Trudi and Steve relocated from Edinburgh to North Yorkshire in order to be closer to family

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: The boys take on a 1963 Citroen HY Van for a family whose lives were torn apart by the Manchester arena suicide bombing in 2017

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wrestling promoter Dale Harvey hosts the first dinner party in Derby, where he hopes to impress aspiring thespian Beth Dunmore, business support manager Jo-Anna, mother-of-three Ondine Shardlow, and triathlete David Morris with a wrestling-themed extravaganza featuring large men in tight lycra. However, a fractious royal debate dampens the mood

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Business support manager Jo-Anna hosts the second dinner party in Derby, and hopes to wow her guests with a glitz and glam evening - complete with ball gowns and poetry. However, David is hoping for a more lively night - and his antics do not impress fellow contestant Dale

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: PR whizz Beth Dunmore hosts the third night in Derby, and she hopes to impress her guests with her vaguely Middle Eastern menu. However, she has her work cut out when it comes to the fussy David Morris, whose confidence seems to be growing as the week progresses. Beth has a fan in cruise ship connoisseur Jo-Anna, though, while single mum Ondine Shardlow is disappointed with the level of competition and thinks she has the week in the bag

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ondine Shardlow hosts the fourth dinner party in Derby, hoping to impress her guests with a flavoursome Greek holiday-inspired menu. However, her carefully planned evening takes a turn for the worse when she manages to insult Dale, and Jo-Anna displays some questionable table manners

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final day of the dinner party contest in Derby and the turn of triathlete David Morris to serve his offerings. Ondine is not impressed by his small portions, big flavours approach, and is even less satisfied with Jo-Anna's behaviour during the week. The host throws an impromptu work-out class where wrestling promoter Dale Harvey is put through his paces, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Engaged couple Rosie Lewis and Dexter Green get the competition underway, welcoming their rivals to the Bae Abermaw Hotel in Barmouth, north Wales. Their guests are wowed by the views from their rooms, but Tracy finds herself in a hairy situation. At dinner, Rosie and Dexter's romantic revelations and confessions surprise their guests. Their breakfast sets the standard for the rest of the week, while Tracy sets herself up as the one to watch, with some observations about her room that she's keen to bring to everyone's attention

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to Rigsby's Guest House in Hertfordshire, where owner Morris Cockman entertains his rivals with a visit to a local zoo. Not all of his guests are impressed, and a slow breakfast service does not improve his chances of success

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Pub landlord John Adams and his friend Dennis Gowie welcome their rivals to The Somerset Arms in Semington, Wiltshire, where Rosie and Dexter have some cleanliness issues in their room

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Nici Van Valen welcomes the contestants to the Cross Keys Hotel in Saffron Walden, Essex, for the final visit of the week, but a mark on Tracy's towel leaves a stain on her stay and a revelation at dinner leads to tension

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to settle some scores. The Bae Abermaw Hotel is first and hosts Rosie and Dexter want to get to the bottom of Tracy's broken bath issue

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: In Northumberland, Hugh and the team excavate the birthplace of one of the country's most famous naturalists and engravers, Thomas Bewick

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 63-year-old builder falls from a great height while working on a construction site, and his daughter shares her stories of the sacrifices he made for her. Doctors fear a teenager who has been hit by a car may have sustained brain injuries, while a man who collapsed while playing golf talks about his unconventional upbringing in Kenya and how he had to adapt to fulfill his dreams

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An episode following the stories of fathers and sons and the bonds between them. John is rushed into St George's with a life threatening abdominal aortic aneurysm. As the doctors work out whether they can save the 77-year-old's life with emergency surgery, his only son discusses the prospect of losing his father. Elsewhere, cameras follow Jamie, whose motorbike collided with a car on a motorway slip road on his way to work, and carpenter Noel arrives in A&E after partially amputating his thumb

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts and regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate as Jon Richardson and Jo Brand take on Joe Wilkinson and Jamali Maddix. Rachel Parris is in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Sean Lock and Kerry Godliman take on Jon Richardson and Joe Wilkinson in the comedy words and numbers quiz, while Mr Swallow - aka Nick Mohammed - joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. Hosted by Jimmy Carr with Rachel Riley looking after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 63-year-old builder falls from a great height while working on a construction site, and his daughter shares her stories of the sacrifices he made for her. Doctors fear a teenager who has been hit by a car may have sustained brain injuries, while a man who collapsed while playing golf talks about his unconventional upbringing in Kenya and how he had to adapt to fulfill his dreams

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An episode following the stories of fathers and sons and the bonds between them. John is rushed into St George's with a life threatening abdominal aortic aneurysm. As the doctors work out whether they can save the 77-year-old's life with emergency surgery, his only son discusses the prospect of losing his father. Elsewhere, cameras follow Jamie, whose motorbike collided with a car on a motorway slip road on his way to work, and carpenter Noel arrives in A&E after partially amputating his thumb

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt visits China to find out how they maximise the chances of finding pearls, and helps to cultivate them from a surprising creature that is definitely not an oyster. Meanwhile, Kate Quilton investigates whether it is safe to eat sliced ham that has developed a weird rainbow pattern, and discovers a bizarre connection between the meat and butterflies

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets a man trying to build the first UFO-styled prefabricated Futuro house seen in Britain for 50 years, and a woman creating a magical garden room using centuries-old techniques, involving earth, sand, straw and even human hair. George's Italian road trip takes him to a traditional village, where he discovers the most modern of houses with an extraordinary design featuring a floating swimming pool. And, as he and Will get down to work on their wilderness retreat, there's a close shave involving an oak tree

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: Award-winning architect Jo Cowen, who has worked on projects including the British Museum and the JP Morgan tower at Canary Wharf, is called in to help Croydon couple Denise and Ali breathe new life into their uninspiring council house. She plans a striking glazed extension, and comes up with a further idea for the upstairs that requires an extra £40,000 on top of the not inconsiderable £120,000 budget. But problems begin to appear, pushing the couple to the brink

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George travels to Margate, where Joanna and Simon have bought themselves a large Victorian semi-detached house, only to become overwhelmed by the refurbishment task ahead. He also visits a grand Georgian manor built in 1820 and frequented by King Edward VII. The Worthing property was divided into flats in the 1980s and it is in one of these that owners Charlie and Julie are wrestling with how to turn a big Regency reception room into contemporary living and dining space

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition heads to Manchester, where battling it out for the £1,000 cash prize are part-time DJ Dom, 35-year old barber Danny, trainee barrister Sasha, nurse Katherine and goth Maria. In the first edition, DJ Dom kicks off the week serving up a menu inspired by the 1990s 'Madchester' music scene

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trainee barrister Sasha hosts the second night in Manchester, where she hopes to impress her guests with a Chinese-Pakistani fusion menu. Meanwhile, fellow contestant Maria reveals more about her love of gothic culture, and Danny discusses his soon-to-be-written autobiography

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nurse Katherine hosts the third dinner party in Manchester, and she opts for a simple menu of a smoked salmon with horseradish cream starter, and a chorizo and chickpea main course. At the table, direct questioning and some extraordinary revelations cause some of the guests to feel uncomfortable

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Barber Danny hosts the fourth night of the competition in Manchester, and decides on an evening of Bulgarian cuisine as a homage to his wife. His party ends with some Bulgarian language lessons that bemuse fellow diners Dom and Maria

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final night in Manchester and glamorous goth Maria is hoping to wow her guests with her twist on Asian cuisine. Some of the guests are feeling a little uneasy that the host will impart her love of vampire culture upon her menu, but the blood-free dishes even manage to impress daddy's girl Sasha. However, an avant-garde transgender dancer creates a stir, and at one point it seems possible that Maria has bitten off more than she can chew

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: General manager Garry Healey and housekeeper Zara Doherty welcome their rivals to the Cliffemount Hotel in Runswick Bay in North Yorkshire. Guests Lana and Alistair are wowed by the views, but Belgian sisters Daniele and Chantal don't think the décor reflects their surroundings. After an afternoon fossil hunting on the beach, Garry entertains his guests at dinner with a taste of his past, and gives them a sight to remember. In the morning, Claire and Adam think their breakfast lacks flavour, and the feedback leaves Garry and Zara wanting answers

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Hospitality newcomers Alistair Arundel and Lana Keptanare welcome their rivals to the Quayside Hotel in Boston in Lincolnshire. Most of the guests are bowled over by the bling, but Claire feels like she's stuck in a neon nightmare. Feathers are ruffled during an afternoon of parrot-handling, with Garry and Zara feeling that Claire and Adam have shown their true colours. At dinner, the guests are impressed by Alistair and Lana's renovation story, but Alistair takes a dim view of Claire's LED criticism

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Claire Lennon and Adam De Marco welcome their rivals to Hollington Park Glamping near Newbury, Berkshire. Sisters Daniele and Chantal are happy glampers but the other guests are shocked by the communal composting toilet. After an arty afternoon, Garry and Zara put aside their differences with their hosts. At dinner, Lana and Alistair don't hold back their feelings about camping, and at breakfast they reveal the full horror of their night under the stars. The feedback reveals that sharing isn't caring when it comes to the communal composting loo, and Claire and Adam have to face the fact that glamping isn't to everyone's taste

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Sisters Daniele Spiers and Chantal Wirth welcome their rivals to Swan House in Kelvedon in Essex. The traditional decor impresses the guests, but there's cleanliness criticism all round, and Lana has wardrobe woes. During an afternoon of wine tasting, Claire and Adam reveal that their feedback hasn't left a bad taste in the mouth, and over dinner the group finds out more about Daniele's romantic past. In the morning, Garry and Zara wake up on the wrong side of bed after a disturbed night's sleep

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. The Cliffemount Hotel is first to host and Garry and Zara want to get to grips with Claire and Adam's breakfast grumbles

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The culinary contest arrives in Hull as five more diners hope to claim the grand prize of £1,000. The first to host a party this week is 29-year-old welfare team leader Jennie, who decides to honour her home city's fishing history with an under-the-sea themed dinner. However, her guests prove to be a lively bunch, twerking their way through dinner, and throwing in a few seal impressions along the way

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wrestling promoter and novice cook James hosts the second night in Hull, and he hopes to wow his guests with a Mexican-themed party complete with a wrestling match as the evening's entertainment. However, his costume requirements, and his spicy food, may be too much for some of the attendees

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wedding stationery entrepreneur Katrena hosts the third dinner party in Hull, and hopes to impress her guests with a cruise-ship-themed night featuring a pink strawberry soup starter, a sparkling lemon iceberg dessert and towel-folding entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mum-of-three Natalie hopes that her choice of good quality produce can help her to impress her guests on the fourth night of the competition in Hull, East Yorkshire. However, the evening does not get off to the best start when community manager George wrongly guesses that she is the grandmother of her two-year-old daughter, and entrepreneur Katrena is insulted by one of the host's questions

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final dinner party in Hull and the turn of community manager George to entertain the guests. Having spent the week heavily criticising everyone else's cooking, the host faces great scrutiny with his menu of simple yet tasty favourites. It remains to be seen whether his egg drop soup and flambeed crepes Suzettes live up to expectations, before the winner of the cash prize is revealed

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics are called to a woman who has been involved in a road traffic collision having only recently recovered from a back injury caused by a previous car accident. The paramedics also treat a patient showing signs of sepsis who has a heart rate of 200. The heart cannot sustain such a workload and eventually will stop if not treated urgently

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A patient is brought in having broken his leg playing American football, while a resident at a neurological hospital is examined for signs that he has suffered a stroke. A man experiencing dizzy spells is accompanied on a trip to St George's by his granddaughter, who shares her memories of how he filled a gap in her life after her father died

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck for a motorcyclist with multiple fractures. Dr Emma and Nurse Emma are worried that a 79-year-old grandmother might lose her leg after she was hit by a car

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: A tennis player is put into an induced coma after suffering a heart attack on the court, a fell runner is seriously injured by cows, and a man is crushed under a collapsed wall

programme.title: The Good Doctor
programme.desc: Shaun is put in a difficult position when the family of a transgender cancer patient insist they know what is best for her. Freddie Highmore stars in the medical drama

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics are called to a woman who has been involved in a road traffic collision having only recently recovered from a back injury caused by a previous car accident. The paramedics also treat a patient showing signs of sepsis who has a heart rate of 200. The heart cannot sustain such a workload and eventually will stop if not treated urgently

A man experiencing dizzy spells is accompanied on a trip to St George's by his granddaughter, who shares her memories of how he filled a gap in her life after her father died

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty wants to know why jelly won't set if chopped papaya is added to it, so he visits South Africa and discovers that the exotic fruit contains enzymes that can also help tenderise meat. In Hawaii, Kate Quilton visits America's only tuna auction to find out why some fish have dangerous levels of mercury, while others don't. She also visits a groundbreaking tech start-up in San Francisco that hopes to feed the world by growing fish flesh in a dish. Matt Tebbutt finds out why homemade ice cubes are cloudy, when the ones bought in shops are clear

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Reality TV star Sam Thompson and TV personality Debbie McGee test their craft skills with pretty marbled clay napkin rings

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Sam and Elaine from Bolton find their perfect holiday home near Carcassonne in the south of France. They've been married for 25 years and have two grown-up children, and think the time is right to buy their dream home in their favourite holiday spot. With a budget of £225,000 and five impressive properties to consider, Jonnie sets out to deliver this family's dream

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: In Portugal, a couple attempt to run a yoga retreat. In France, two Londoners plan to open a gîte. A couple try to renovate a run-down house in Spain into a luxury holiday let

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien turn an old, unloved filing cabinet into a valuable and desirable storage unit and convert a Bakelite voltmeter into a retro Bluetooth speaker

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien search for more gems hidden among unwanted possessions, trying to make a profit from church organ pipes and old leather sports car seats

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers look for an heir to the estate of Second World War spy Eileen Nearne, and explore whether Albert Cornish from Hackney, who died in 2004, owned his life-long home. Plus, details of unclaimed estates where beneficiaries still need to be found

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: Probate detectives visit Essex to search for the rightful inheritors of carpenter Ernest Wright's £200,000 estate. Elsewhere, investigators try to trace the relatives of Howard Soberg, a former submariner, and learn about his family's desperate efforts to find him. The programme also features an appeal for information regarding three more unclaimed estates

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at the Holland Hall Hotel in Upholland, Lancashire, where two of the guests are less than impressed when the breakfast table is laid with steak knives

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to The Railway Inn near Hull in East Yorkshire, where young couple Lydia Perkins and Luke Mainprize feel the pressure at breakfast time

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at The Driftwood B&B in Weymouth, where guest Lygia prepares to party when she spies the host's disco balls

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the Bull Hotel in Wrotham, Kent, where owner Lygia Fontanella-Deadman prides herself on a luxury stay. But a surprise leads to criticism from one couple

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores. Genice and Cathy want Lydia and Luke to shed some light on the wardrobe situation

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the hidden lives of the animals of Chester Zoo. The Asian elephant family welcome a new arrival. Grumpy matriarch Thi has been pregnant for almost two years and is reaching the end of her tether. She's given birth to a stillborn baby in the past, so the keepers have a close eye on her. Cameras also follow Red panda Jung, who has been getting the cold shoulder from his partner Nima since they had two cubs

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: A Liverpool family face a difficult decision choosing which one of a litter of 10 German shepherd puppies to take home with them. The Woodgreen staff also hope a Staffordshire bull terrier, brought in by social services after an incident in its previous home, will be able to find a more understanding owner, and a Yorkshire terrier with a big attitude tries to win over a couple

programme.title: PopMaster TV
programme.desc: Ken Bruce presents the grand final of the first TV version of the radio quiz, with the winners of each of this week's episodes returning for the ultimate test

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw head to Stockport to take on a 1994 Vauxhall Cavalier Turbo owned by Darren. After a horrific accident, Darren was left tetraplegic and unable to move from the neck down. Darren's condition has meant his Cavalier ended up on the front drive. Darren's friends are hoping that Car SOS are able to convert the car to allow him to be a passenger and satisfy his need for speed again

programme.title: Guy Martin's Spitfire
programme.desc: In May 1940, a Mark 1 Spitfire was shot down and crash-landed on a beach in northern France, where it slowly sank into the sand. The wreckage was finally recovered in the 1980s and stored in France for more than 20 years. In this programme, motorcycle racer and mechanic Guy Martin joins a two-year project to rebuild the aeroplane, revealing the engineering and skills involved, and providing a fitting homage to the bravery of everyone involved in its service

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

In Birmingham, paramedics Jo Hardwick and Peter Bowles treat a five-year-old boy who is having an asthma attack; and, across the city, student paramedic Dave Watts must attend his first cardiac arrest when an elderly woman is found in her bed without a pulse

programme.desc: Rimmer's swashbuckling alter ego returns to the Starbug suffering from fatal injuries and asks his cowardly lookalike to replace him as guardian of the universe. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles and Danny John-Jules

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Bob Mortimer has harboured a childhood dream to catch a salmon, so together with friend Paul Whitehouse, he sets off for the River Tay in Scotland full of hope and excitement. A ghillie guides them up the intimidating river in a boat and they fish using various methods to catch the elusive fish. They stay in the heart of the Highlands, where Bob cooks Paul a traditional Scottish breakfast and enjoy a swift round of golf before resuming their fishing. The duo also reflect on luck and fate and the part it has played in their lives and later assess whether the trip has lived up to their expectations

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Sitting side by side on the banks of the Upper Tamar Lakes, Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer fish for the predatory perch. Bob notices that Paul has far more superior seating, which causes momentary tension between the pair. The tables are turned when Bob reveals this week's accommodation - leaving Paul almost speechless. The following day the duo brave the open sea and have a very surprising catch. They celebrate in the only way possible in the south-west of England - it's not particularly heart-healthy but it proves to be very tasty

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a project to build a car that can turn into a hovercraft and bring relief to flooded areas. Their efforts do not start smoothly, but it is not long before the trio are demonstrating the brilliance of their creation with an eventful journey down the River Avon. Plus, Jeremy grabs the keys to two variants of the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG supercar - the V8-engined Black Series with a roaring 622bhp, and the 740bhp Electric Drive, which is powered by four electric motors. X-Men and Les Miserables star Hugh Jackman is the latest celebrity to take the new Reasonably Priced Car around the test track

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May take a look at increasingly popular tall hatchbacks known as crossovers. Having concluded their primary appeal is to caravanners, the duo spend a couple of days in models by Mazda and Volkswagen and try to get a feel for what life is like for the people they believe would buy one. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond drives a pair of exciting Lamborghinis in Italy - the ferocious Aventador Roadster and the limited-edition Sesto Elemento, which carries an eye-watering price tag of around £2million. Two cars are also put through their paces on the test track, with James in a modern re-creation of the classic Porsche 911 and Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler in the rather less exotic Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are sent to Bolivia, where they are challenged to travel through the rainforest and journey to the coast of Chile, driving second-hand off-road vehicles bought locally for a maximum of £3,500 each. Along the way, they encounter drug lords and feel the effects of altitude sickness as they negotiate the region's roads, one of which is a notoriously dangerous 40-mile mountain pass dubbed El Camino de la Muerte - the Death Road

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris, Paddy McGuiness and Freddie Flintoff aren't choosing their own cars, but instead choosing for one another. After unwrapping their presents in the Welsh village of Bethlehem, the trio set off on a yuletide trek across Britain, stopping off to play the game of 'High-Speed Visual Charades' and deliver an enormous tree to the Unesco World Heritage city of Bath. Then it's time for the presenters to visit the Top Gear test track, transformed into a winter wonderland of speed

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo travels from the Swiss Alps to the shores of Lake Geneva. Along the way, he is caught up in a war zone with the Red Cross and rescued from an 'avalanche' by a St Bernard puppy. He takes to the skies in a vintage bi-plane to retrace the epic journey of the pioneering pilot who was first to fly over the Alps, and tries his hand at watchmaking, James Bond style

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo leaves Europe behind to take in the sights, smells and tastes of North Africa as he travels from the Mediterranean port of Tangier to the Berber city of Marrakech. At Asilah, the political commentator lends a hand with the construction of Morocco's new £3billion high-speed railway line to Casablanca, where he calls in to the most famous gin joint in the world

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from the Italian Riviera to the Austrian Alps, starting in Genoa, where he learns how an Edwardian Briton introduced football to the port. He takes the train as it clings to the cliffs along the Riviera Di Levanti to reach the picturesque and remote villages of the Cinque Terre, now a UNESCO World Heritage Site, before ending his journey in the famous Brenner Pass, the scene of a ground-breaking engineering project to build one of the world's longest rail tunnels

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo braves the freezing temperatures of the Baltic Sea and finds peace paddling a canoe on the Lakes of Finland. On his journey from the Latvian capital Riga to Tampere in Finland, he encounters medieval knights in Tallinn, grills sausages in Helsinki and samples cloudberry liqueur in a hot tub. He later arrives in Estonia, where in the setting of a ruined 13th-century cathedral he learns how the Baltic countries demonstrated their desire for independence from the Soviet Union with a 'singing revolution'

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo concludes his journey in the Netherlands, where he travels from Rotterdam to Utrecht, including a visit to the world's largest flower auction in Haarlem, a trip to Delft to learn how the city came to specialise in pottery and an exploration of the government buildings in The Hague

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Guided by his Bradshaw's 1913 Handbook of Indian, Foreign and Colonial Travel, Michael Portillo travels across India

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Margaret comes into money, Victor tries to help a Dutch girl get back on her feet, and builders arrive to start the loft conversion, leaving chaos in their wake. Comedy, guest starring Christopher Ryan (The Young Ones), with Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor receives an unlikely job offer that paves the way to disaster, and Margaret plays Cupid to Nick Swainey and a nurse. programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: The broadcaster travels from the west of Morocco to the east, heading into the desert on a mission to find out whether a railway line once crossed the Sahara all the way to Timbuktu in Mali. He begins in Marrakesh, taking in Casablanca and Fez before visiting a town that he is convinced has been named in his honour

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris sets out on a mission to cross three former Soviet republics entirely by rail in just one week, travelling through Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania and uncovering amazing stories and dark secrets from the region's past. He begins in Narva, Estonia, before heading to the capital Tallinn on the country's oldest railway, built by German nobles to connect the Russian imperial capital St Petersburg with Estonia's ports, then travelling through Latvia and Lithuania and heading to the Russian border on a revolutionary new line

programme.desc: A secret weapons program in the heart of Austria that could have ended badly for the Allies - and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler

programme.desc: The people responsible for tracking down war criminals who had evaded capture, beginning with the US army task force in charge of locating German scientists

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of Hitler's personal secretary Martin Bormann and the efforts to track him down. With insufficient evidence to confirm the Nazi official's death, the International Military Tribunal at Nuremberg tried him in absentia during 1946 and eventually sentenced him to death. Despite extensive efforts, he was never found and was eventually presumed to have died in May 1945

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: How the SAS War Crimes Investigation Team tried to pinpoint the location of Gestapo officers who were wanted for a host of atrocities

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits the Worcestershire village of Hartlebury, which was once home to a bishop who captured Queen Victoria's attention, on the second leg of his journey from Oxford to the south Wales coast. He also investigates the secrets of Worcestershire sauce and learns why the Malvern Hills were popular with 19th-century health enthusiasts

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo discovers micro-mines hidden in the Forest of Dean, Gloucestershire, and finds out why the Victorians were so enamoured with Tintern Abbey in the Wye Valley along the border between England and Wales. Plus, he investigates the railway engineering behind the Newport Transporter Bridge

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo discovers the importance of Cardiff's Victorian coal heritage to the city's development. He also finds out why Barry Island has been attached to the mainland since the 19th century, and takes a steam ride through the Brecon Beacons National Park

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ends his journey through the west of England and south Wales by exploring the connection between the Victorian railway and Port Talbot's steelworks. He then follows the trail of 19th-century waterfall hunters in Neath, and reveals Milford Haven's whaling past

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins his journey to the Isle of Man from Berwick-upon-Tweed, Northumberland, and examines the cross-border history of the town. Plus, he hears the story of the Pitman Painters of Ashington and learns about the perils of working on the rails in Victorian times

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the second leg of his journey from Berwick-upon-Tweed to the Isle of Man, beginning in the Northumberland village of Bardon Mill. He follows in the footsteps of Victorian archaeologists at Hadrian's Wall, discovers how the introduction of ticket machines transformed 19th-century train travel and learns about the impact of railways on the west Cumbrian town of Wigton

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads to Cumbria, where he visits the Sellafield site that reprocesses fuel from nuclear reactors, drinks a Victorian brew made from the waters of Cockermouth and explores a Japanese-inspired garden created in the 19th century

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris Tarrant explores five countries that were part of Yugoslavia, which had an extensive state-run railway network before its break-up in the 1990s and the Balkan Wars of Independence that followed. From Slovenia, Chris heads east along an old Austro-Hungarian railway that was once used by the Orient Express, pays a visit to a very unusual railway-related battlefield in Bosnia and rides on one of the world's great mountain railways on his way to the Serbian capital Belgrade before finishing his journey in Montenegro

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris travels through the Middle East to explore what remains of the colonial railways, which were built there more than 100 years ago. In the Wadi Rum valley, Chris boards a steam train along one of the few bits of the Hejaz railway that remains in working use, following the route through Jordan, before crossing the border into Israel as he heads for Jerusalem, which is sacred to more than half of the world's population. Along the way, Chris visits the ancient city of Petra, as well as Haifa and Tel Aviva

However, revealing the inspiration behind her starter might be a step too far for her guests, especially after the revelations found inside her 'special' cupboard!

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Portsmouth at the Seacrest Hotel, where owner Antoinette Stretton and general manager Carmen Cretu hope their experience will set them apart

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The White Horse Hotel in Storrington, West Sussex, is today's venue. The discovery of damp is a cause for concern - and emotions run high as the scores are handed out

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at Deri-Down Guesthouse in Abergavenny, Wales, where husbands and wife Mike and Del Hayward hope to impress their rivals

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Royle Farm in Staffordshire, where mother and son Margaret and Fraser Mountford hope their farmhouse with a difference will capture the guests' imaginations

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet up for a final showdown. Next, Glenn and Leon comb through Mike and Del's cleanliness comments, before delving into discussions of damp with Antoinette and Carmen. After opinions are aired and differences debated, the payments are revealed and the winner is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Mike Bodnar and Liz Prendergast live on a houseboat in France for most of the year, but would like somewhere warmer for the winter months. They know the sun always shines in Tenerife, but are also drawn to Mike's native Liverpool as they have friends there and Liz could get work. Jasmine Harman and Sara Damergi help them make up their minds

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi assists a couple seeking a property on the southern Spanish Costa Blanca with beautiful views. The presenter shows Reg and Val Thorne what their £82,000 budget will stretch to, but has difficulty finding a house that the pair can agree on

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Property experts Jasmine Harman and Sara Damergi help Nathan and Georgina Spender, who are hoping to invest some money they inherited from their parents by downsizing in Leicestershire and buying a property in Lanzarote that they can initially use for holidays, with a view to eventually making it their permanent home

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Bedfordshire couple John and Elaine Want plan a permanent move to the Alicante region of southern Spain, and Sara Damergi takes them to view potential homes within their budget of £70,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sports fan and rugby coach Matt loves all-things Italian and dreams of buying a holiday home near the historic city of Lucca in Tuscany. He's looking for a property with two bedrooms in a lively location, and brings along his best friend Shaun for some straight-talking advice. Jean Johansson secures the options of five properties for him to vivist within his £190,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Themis and Paolo have been visiting the unspoilt beaches of Kapparis in Cyprus for the past six years and now they want to buy their own holiday home. Jasmine Harman lines up five properties for their £180,000 budget

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Members of the Fullagar family get more than they bargained for when they are introduced to father and daughter, Pepe and Tink - who can't be separated. Meanwhile, Louise and Angela are conflicted when Trinity a five-month-old lurcher puppy shows off both her adorable side and an impressive ability to chew everything from furniture to shoes

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets actor Sean Simons, who has bought the ruins of Cloontykilla Castle in Co Roscommon with a view to using them to create a spectacular mock 16th-century home. However, the outlandish plans - including Jacuzzis in the battlements and water-spouting gargoyles - have Kevin worried the project could become a garish nightmare, and his scepticism increases when he realises Sean has not consulted an architect. Disaster seems to be looming as the contractors grow frustrated and planning regulations are ignored, but somehow things slowly begin to take shape - until a national economic crisis plunges everything into chaos

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody: The Home County Cartel
programme.desc: Part two of two. The covert team tries to find the true identity of Jaguar Palace, as well as the evidence to link the suspect directly to the drug-importing conspiracy. The detectives begin a nerve-shredding wait for the criminal network to set up its lucrative operation again, and stand ready to strike against the ringleaders when it does

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Nurse Emma is called to resus to help 71-year-old Thomas who has had a suspected stroke, and has a narrow window of time to give Thomas a life-saving drug. While treating him, Emma tells us the story of how she went from working in a dry-cleaners as a teenager to pursuing a career as a stroke nurse. At the same time, 88-year-old Mary is rushed to St George's after falling at home and injuring her head

programme.title: Larry Dean: Fandan
programme.desc: The double Edinburgh Comedy Award nominee performs his debut special, recorded in his hometown of Glasgow. Larry journeys through ghosting, battling the organised partner in relationships, and announcing his sexuality with a bang - in a proudly Scottish voice

programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts, as Jack Dee and Tom Allen take on Jon Richardson and Judi Love. John Cooper Clarke is in Dictionary Corner. Regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate

programme.title: Wonders of the World I Can't See
programme.desc: Chris McCausland is joined by comedian and presenter Tom Allen in Rome, where they eat ice cream before it melts, zip around the city on a rickety Vespa, train to be gladiators, learn to sing opera and make pasta from scratch. And will Tom's one-of-a-kind commentary do the Colosseum justice for Chris?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at the Coachman Inn in Hartford, Cheshire, where owner Justin Hyam surprises his guests with a romantic revelation at dinner and a breakfast bombshell

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The Foxhall Village Guest House in Blackpool is this week's second venue, where the food falls short of expectations and not everyone has a good night's sleep

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at the Douglas Hotel in Hartlepool, where owner Raqeeb Ramzan and his uncle Raj Malik hope to impress their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mike and Sue Brierley welcome their rivals to Gables Pod Camping in Escomb in County Durham. Their guests are pleased with the pods, but while Justin basks in his bunk bed, Tina worries about where she's going to sleep. Over dinner, Mike and Sue's revelation about how they met amuses their guests, but the fun atmosphere is soon replaced by an awkward tension when payment day is discussed, and the evening ends with one guest on a sofa and another in a hot tub

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Gemma Longworth head to Co Antrim, where they find a farm stuffed with antique tractors and an old tin smith's studio that's a treasure trove of antique furniture

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Max McMurdo head for Crewe to meet rock 'n' roller Billy, who lives in a house that is frozen in time in the 1950s

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Liverpool pair Jeanette and Ian have dreamed for years about owning a holiday home by Spain's popular Mar Menor, and with retirement approaching they feel it's the right time to make that dream come true. Scarlette Douglas impresses them with five properties to choose between within their budget of £75,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Retired company director Bob and ice-skating coach Sammi seek a holiday home around the lively resort of Corralejo on Fuerteventura, in the Canary Islands, where their children and grandchildren can also come and stay. Laura Hamilton shows them five options for their budget of £150,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jean Johansson helps Julie and Derek look for their dream home in Tarbes at the foothills of the Pyrenees in southern France. The couple are looking for a two-bedroom house with the 'shabby-chic' style they love and a good amount of land for Julie to start an alpaca walking business on a budget of £130,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Peter and Karen Greaves from Wiltshire want a bolthole on Spain's Costa Blanca that they can escape to at a moment's notice. Sara Damergi shows them a selection of properties for £50,000 or less

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jean Johansson helps Jeffrey and Trudi from Lincoln to find a home in Spain's Alicante Province, on a budget of £220,000 raised from the sale of their home in the UK

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search Glasgow with two couples whose budgets will not stretch to what they want. Kirstie is with Laura and Euan, who have recently returned to their native Glasgow from Sydney. But they are torn between their desire to be close to the vibrant West End or further out, where their budget will buy them something bigger. Phil has a wide brief with Miriam and David, who have spent eight months searching for their new home. He soon has success - the only problem is, they have each fallen for a different house

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows from early March 2022, including Peaky Blinders, Love Is Blind, Coronation Street, Celebrity Hunted, Starstruck and Celebrity Mastermind. programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.title: Sarah Millican: Home Bird Live (2014)
programme.desc: Stand-up show recorded in 2014 at Newcastle's Tyne Theatre & Opera House, in which the comedian shares humorous insights into her life, including the need to put down some roots now she has cats. Plus, she offers advice on what to take away on a dirty weekend, how to teach a pensioner to swear and the correct number of meals to consume in a day

programme.title: Evacuation
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of the evacuation of Kabul, using MoD footage shot by combat camera teams and revealing personal accounts of the operation. In the first episode, a small British military team is sent out to prepare for a possible evacuation, but nobody knows quite what to expect. Suddenly, the Taliban shock the world by taking Kabul. The military scramble to clear the airfield of thousands of panicked civilians. Can they regain control and start the evacuation?

programme.title: Jon Snow: A Witness to History
programme.desc: The newsreader shares his unique experiences and what they've taught him about humanity in the course of his 32-year career as a world-renowned reporter and Channel 4 News anchor. Finally, Maxine and Lee hope their cryptic menu and Maxine's cooking skills will come as a welcome, point-scoring surprise in their bid to throw the perfect dinner party

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: In the Dordogne, Nick gets demolition-happy in a bid to finish opening up the entrance hall of their derelict château, but Nicole is worried he'll come down with the ceiling. It's a big day for Becky and Mark as the new floor in the gîte is laid. Mark has to manage thousands of gallons of fast-flowing concrete. Wendy has grand plans to build an elegant wedding garden for couples to wed in, but Marcus has to figure out the measurements of the second-hand pergola she's bought, which has lain in rusty pieces for the last three years

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Rob and Jan Porter search for a property in Sarasota Bay on Florida's Gulf Coast. The couple have a £120,000 budget for a two-bedroom holiday home where they can escape the rainy winters of north-west England

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: IT architect Anna hosts the first of a week of dinner parties from in and around Cardiff, hoping to impress her guests with a culinary journey celebrating classic British cooking

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On day two in Cardiff, accountant Charlotte is going all out to impress and has spent the cash on a menu of luxury ingredients in her bid to scoop the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beautician Claire hosts the third dinner party in Cardiff, but her decision to serve her favourite dishes on planks instead of plates proves controversial

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Part-time football referee Scott serves up a menu of family favourites in Cardiff, but might have scored an own goal by putting cheese in every course

A mountain guide ensures that walkers attempting the gruelling 24-mile challenge of Yorkshire's Three Peaks in under 12 hours make it to the end of their journey safely

programme.title: Five Star Kitchen: Britain's Next Great Chef
programme.desc: The battle to win the keys to the Palm Court restaurant in London's Langham hotel continues, as the contestants are tasked with reinventing the hotel's afternoon tea while staying true to its restaurant concept, and serving it to discerning diners. It's clear the hopefuls are willing to push the boundaries, coming up with everything from a Mad Hatter's tea party and edible soil to deer heart and delicate entremets. And who will dazzle the most when judge Michel Roux Jr invites them to host a chef's table with a few VIP guests?

programme.title: Moors Murders
programme.desc: Hindley's brother-in-law David Smith and journalist Clive Entwistle describe the killers' trial in 1966, and recall the tension in court as they faced justice, including the moment when a tape recording of a girl being tortured was played. The film also documents Myra Hindley's life in prison, and her protracted, unsuccessful campaign to secure her parole

programme.title: Evacuation
programme.desc: British soldiers come face to face with the enemy when Taliban fighters breach the airfield. But with the Taliban now in control of the country, they're forced to put old hostilities aside as they work together to control the crowds. Young soldiers must make life-and-death decisions on who is eligible for evacuation, while in the air, one pilot narrowly avoids a catastrophic collision - while the RAF must decide whether to overload aircraft to take more evacuees

programme.title: Wonders of the World I Can't See
programme.desc: Chris McCausland visits Jordan in the Middle East with actor, writer and comedian Guz Khan, to visit the magnificent ancient city of Petra. But before they head to the wonder, Chris floats for the first time in his life in the Dead Sea, and the pair almost melt during an intense facial spa treatment. In Petra itself, they haggle with shopkeepers, ride camels and listen to tales told by candlelight, before ending their trip with traditional music and a Bedouin feast

programme.title: Ben Elton: The Great Railway Disaster
programme.desc: The comedian argues that railway privatisation is a failed experiment, travelling through Manchester's Ordsall Chord, an £85 million feat of engineering which currently only runs one train in each direction per hour, and experiencing Britain's worst railway line, the Transpennine Express. Ben reveals the results of a Channel 4 survey which asked 2,000 adults about their experience of using the trains, questioning how problems on the railways have impacted people's everyday lives, changing the way they travel

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: After moving abroad for work, a landlord discovers that his tenants have left him over £20,000 behind with his mortgage, and the developers of an old swimming pool in Bristol discover that they are liable for the electricity that the building's squatters have been using

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords

programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: Police Interceptors

Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Helen Shaver and Ian McShane

Crime drama, starring Peter Falk and Ruth Gordon

Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Roddy McDowall and Ida Lupino

Meanwhile, Adalind considers returning to her career after bumping into a former colleague. David Giuntoli and Russell Hornsby star

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: Documentary series taking viewers inside the UK Border Agency, revealing the work that takes place behind the scenes of the immigration process. programme.title: Sooty
programme.desc: The gang prepare Mr Slater's stately home for a lavish garden party. But with changing weather and a broken statue, can Sooty's magic save the day

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Hell Below
programme.desc: Witness the legendary U-515 as it faces an enemy unlike anything seen in the war before

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: The King of the Unicorns steals Monkey's magic wishing staff, hoping to give it as a present to the son of the woman he's planning to marry

programme.title: How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying (1967)
programme.desc: A lowly window cleaner uses his wiles and ruthlessness to climb the corporate ladder. Musical comedy based on the Broadway show, starring Robert Morse, Michele Lee, Rudy Vallee and Anthony Teague

programme.title: Phaedra (1962)
programme.desc: A Greek shipping magnate marries a younger woman, and sends her to London to bring his estranged son home. The young man begins a passionate affair with his stepmother, but is consumed with guilt for betraying his father. When she learns her husband's plans for his son, she reveals the truth, setting in motion a tragic confrontation. Drama, starring Melina Mercouri and Anthony Perkins

programme.title: The Great Pony Raid (1968)
programme.desc: A gang of children tries to foil a plot to steal Dartmoor ponies. Family drama, starring Edward Underdown and Michael Brennan

programme.title: Big Wheels and Sailor (1979)
programme.desc: The children of long-distance lorry drivers are taken prisoner by a gang of lorry hijackers led by the owner of a cab company, but the captive kids have a trick or two up their sleeves. Children's adventure, starring Nigel Humphreys and Matthew Wright

programme.title: Mudlarking the Thames
programme.desc: Nicola White unearths the river's historical treasures

programme.title: My Greek Odyssey
programme.desc: Peter Maneas journeys through some of the most spectacular Greek islands, exploring the rich culture, history and food of Greece while meeting the locals and those who live there

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: Qantas Flight 32, which on November 4, 2010 suffered an uncontained failure in one of its engines, leading to a series of failures and a tense emergency landing

programme.title: Resistance (2020)
programme.desc: Aspiring mime artist Marcel Marceau joins the French Resistance to save the lives of thousands of children orphaned at the hands of the Nazis, including Klaus Barbie, also known as The Butcher of Lyon. Writer/director Jonathan Jakubowicz's biopic, starring Jesse Eisenberg, Clemence Poesy and Matthias Schweighofer

programme.title: Everything Must Go (2010)
programme.desc: A man's heavy drinking costs him his job and leads to his wife kicking him out of the house. He sets up home on their lawn, amid all the possessions she has thrown out, and to avoid seeming homeless, he begins selling them, leading him to make new friendships with his neighbours and gradually straighten out his life. Comedy drama, starring Will Ferrell and Laura Dern

programme.title: Forget Me Not (2011)
programme.desc: A musician comes to the aid of a barmaid being accosted by a drunk. Together they go on a journey around London and begin to fall in love, but as the night draws to a close, a secret threatens to bring their fledgling relationship to an end before it has begun. Romantic drama, with Tobias Menzies and Genevieve O'Reilly

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours for locals and tourists, exploring Elephant & Castle and Croydon. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Brixton and Harmondsworth for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days.

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital.

programme.title: London's Weekend
programme.desc: A chance to catch up on the week's headlines and a taste of what to see and do in London this weekend.

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Mudlarking the Thames
programme.desc: Nicola White unearths the river's historical treasures

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: This special extended episode shows what goes into the production of London's newest electric taxi

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton returns to visit more islands off the coastline, beginning with the Outer Hebrides. He resumes his journey on Eriskay, where he discovers how the remote location helped preserve a unique way of life for centuries - and also allowed locals to hide thousands of bottles of whisky from the excise men when a ship laden with the thirst-quenching cargo ran aground in 1941. The story inspired the 1949 movie Whisky Galore! Moving on to Barra, Paul goes foraging for cockles and visits the only airport in the world where scheduled flights land on the beach, then heads across to Vatersay, where he joins local fishermen trawling for lobsters

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton explores the Isle of Mull and its satellite islands to discover why they have become boltholes from the hustle and bustle of the modern world. He begins on the tidal island of Erraid, which inspired famous Scottish writer Robert Louis Stevenson, then hops over to Ulva, the final resting place of Lachlan MacQuarrie, one of the first governors of New South Wales. He then explores Mull itself, being given a whistlestop tour of the island by rally driver Louise Thomas, then travels to the mysterious little island of Inch Kenneth, where he hears the story of Nazi sympathizer Unity Mitford. He ends his tour at the remote Treshnish Islands, where he experiences a spot of 'puffin therapy'

programme.title: Big Wheels and Sailor (1979)
programme.desc: The children of long-distance lorry drivers are taken prisoner by a gang of lorry hijackers led by the owner of a cab company, but the captive kids have a trick or two up their sleeves. Children's adventure, starring Nigel Humphreys and Matthew Wright

programme.title: Adventure in the Hopfields (1954)
programme.desc: A little girl accidentally breaks her mother's favourite ornament and goes hop-picking to replace it. Children's adventure, starring Mandy Miller and Hilda Fenemore

programme.title: Dance With Me, Henry (1956)
programme.desc: The owners of a struggling amusement park get mixed up with the Mob as one struggles to pay his debts and the other faces losing his adopted kids. Comedy, with Abbott and Costello

programme.title: Phaedra (1962)
programme.desc: A Greek shipping magnate marries a younger woman, and sends her to London to bring his estranged son home. The young man begins a passionate affair with his stepmother, but is consumed with guilt for betraying his father. When she learns her husband's plans for his son, she reveals the truth, setting in motion a tragic confrontation. Drama, starring Melina Mercouri and Anthony Perkins

programme.title: The Fake (1953)
programme.desc: An American detective tries to trace the theft of a priceless Leonardo painting from the Tate Gallery. Crime drama, starring Dennis O'Keefe and Coleen Gray

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: Music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's most acclaimed choirs featuring regular guest artists

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: The crew is infected by a mysterious illness, and Tony must intervene before it is too late. Sci-fi adventure starring Martin Landau, Barbara Bain, Tony Anholt and Dave Prowse

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: Steed and Mrs Peel visit a mysterious coastal town where several agents have recently vanished, and the locals are not what they may at first seem. Patrick Macnee and Diana Rigg star

programme.title: Winter of Our Dreams (1981)
programme.desc: Prostitute Lou encounters her dead friend's ex, who wants to discover why she committed suicide. A relationship develops between them, but when Lou acquires her friend's diary, she realises to her horror that she is repeating the mistakes of the past. Drama, with Judy Davis and Bryan Brown

programme.title: Albatross (2011)
programme.desc: Bookish teenager Beth is desperate to escape her dull home life. She finds a kindred spirit in Emelia, a troubled 17-year-old with dreams of becoming a writer, who comes to work at her parents' hotel. Emelia forms a friendship with Beth, but also has an affair with her father, which threatens to tear the family apart. Drama, with Jessica Brown Findlay, Felicity Jones, Sebastian Koch and Julia Ormond

programme.title: The L-Shaped Room (1962)
programme.desc: A pregnant French woman gets involved with various strange characters at a boarding house after arriving in London to face some difficult decisions about her future. Drama, starring Leslie Caron, Tom Bell, Bernard Lee and Cicely Courtneidge

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days.

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital.

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Legend of the Dragon
programme.desc: The guardian of the temple has passed on and a new Golden Dragon must be Chosen from a brother and sister - Twins born in the Year of the Dragon. Only one will be chosen. Their sibling bond tested

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Sooty
programme.desc: When the prizes disappear from Mr Slater's new crazy golf course, the famous detectives Sherlock Sooty and Doctor Watsit are called in to investigate. Matthew Corbett guest stars

programme.title: Sooty
programme.desc: Sooty asks the owner of a bird garden to save the day with his clever budgies when a circus fails to turn up to entertain Richard's guests

programme.title: Underwater World for Kids
programme.desc: An underwater adventure that takes in the many natural wonders and magical sea creatures above and below our oceans

programme.title: Hell Below
programme.desc: Two submerged subs battle blind in a rare Second World War attack that changed subsea warfare forever

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Following his departure to Bulgaria, news of Gordon Brittas' apparent death reaches his colleagues at Whitbury Leisure Centre. However, Brittas returns from the dead to cause havoc and Carole is determined to save her baby from his zombie. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours narrated by Dewyne Lindsay, this time exploring Camden and Sydenham for locals and tourists.

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: The King of the Unicorns steals Monkey's magic wishing staff, hoping to give it as a present to the son of the woman he's planning to marry

programme.title: It Always Rains on Sunday (1947)
programme.desc: A convict escapes from prison and heads for London's East End in search of his former lover, hoping she will give him a safe hiding place. She is now married with three children, and is torn between her loyalty to her family and her unresolved feelings for the fugitive. Crime drama based on Arthur La Bern's novel, starring Googie Withers and John McCallum

programme.title: Sky West and Crooked (1965)
programme.desc: A gypsy boy falls for a fey 17-year-old girl who is treated with contempt by her fellow villagers, but the mismatched couple are soon subjected to the deep-seated prejudices of the locals. Romantic drama based on the novel by Mary Hayley Bell, starring Hayley Mills and Ian McShane

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: The crew is infected by a mysterious illness, and Tony must intervene before it is too late. Sci-fi adventure starring Martin Landau, Barbara Bain, Tony Anholt and Dave Prowse

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: London's Screen Archives Presents
programme.desc: A series of hand-picked films celebrating London's rich history on film, from carnival scenes and community gatherings, to jubilee events and the Thames

programme.title: London's Screen Archives Presents
programme.desc: A series of hand-picked films celebrating London's rich history on film, from carnival scenes and community gatherings, to jubilee events and the Thames

programme.title: The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin
programme.desc: Reggie exposes his insecurities and much more during a disastrous speech to the British Fruit Association. But it soon transpires that it's all part of his master plan. Comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter and Pauline Yates

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: Exploring legends of London to get to the bottom of what's fact and what's fiction

programme.title: The Alan Clark Diaries
programme.desc: John Hurt takes the lead in this drama series charting the life of the politician from 1983 to his death in 1999, based on his infamous series of diaries, and following his constantly thwarted attempts to get into the Tory Cabinet. Appointed Parliamentary Undersecretary at the Department of Employment, Clark's initial enthusiasm soon falls foul of his taste for alcohol, as he turns up drunk in the House of Commons. Has his career ended before it's begun? Jenny Agutter and Julia Davis co-star

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Quest Boxing League
programme.desc: Welcome to the UK's toughest boxing competition, where aspiring young boxers battle it out inside the ring for their chance to be crowned the Quest Boxing League Champion.

programme.title: The Dark Horse (2014)
programme.desc: A bipolar chess champion is released from a psychiatric hospital with nowhere to go, so moves in with his gang member brother. Needing a purpose, he forms a club to teach his skills to a group of underprivileged youngsters, but struggles with the strain of being a role model, particularly when his nephew seems set to follow in his father's criminal footsteps. Fact-based drama, starring Cliff Curtis and James Rolleston
